meta.name: Alice in Wonderland
meta.description: An 8-scenario campaign that can be played forwards or backwards, mixing Arkham with the Lewis Carroll classics.
meta.author: The Beard

cards.name: Arkham in Wonderland
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to the number of [[Wonderland]] locations in play (max 5).
[elder_thing]: –2. If you are at a [[Wonderland]] location, discard a card from your hand at random.

cards.name: Arkham in Wonderland
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 1 plus the number of [[Wonderland]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you are at a [[Wonderland]] location, discard a card from your hand at random.

cards.flavor: Strange waves of distortion sweep over Arkham, devolving it quickly into chaos. The city is rapidly being warped and blended with the Wonderland of Alice's dreams. Buildings and landmarks distort into unfamiliar forms, while the people unfortunate enough to be caught in these ripples are likewise distorted. You hope that you can find some way to stop or reverse these changes before you yourself are transformed by the events.
cards.name: A Tide of Madness
What Dreams May Come
cards.text:
The city is coming apart at the seams, while shadowy creatures further unravel it by consuming anything they can tear apart. Buildings collapse as their bricks turn into ivory dominoes, street lamps pop and blossom like daisies, and the very ground shifts like a rug on a polished floor. As distortions grow stronger, you wonder if the changes can possibly be reversed.
Choose the [[Arkham]] location that is closest to Arkham Asylum that does not have the [[Wonderland]] trait. Flip that location to its [[Wonderland]] side and place 1[per_investigator] clues on it. Each investigator at that location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. If each [[Arkham]] location in play also has the [[Wonderland]] trait, each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice). Otherwise, flip this agenda.

cards.flavor: You question the strange cat, but it speaks in circular logic and nonsensical terms. You get the feeling that it is testing you rather than helping you. If you want actual answers on how to stop Gurathnaka, you'll have to scour the city and watch the changes up-close.
cards.name: Sphinx's Riddle
New Neighbors
cards.text:
The cat appears again on a tree limb just above you, grinning as ever. "Truth is far more true when found than told," it purrs, "but the shadows are growing long. Don't you think it's time you went home? Not your home, of course, but Alice's. It's in the neighborhood, you see."
Put the set-aside Abandoned House into play. The lead investigator must immediately take control of the set-aside The Cheshire Cat (Grinning Guide) card. Shuffle the set-aside Cheshire Cat encounter set into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Amid the chaotic overlap of this other world, an English country house has appeared in the neighborhood just south of you. If what the cat suggested is true, then the key to stopping these worlds from merging lies inside.
cards.name: House Sitting
cards.text: Objective - After an investigator enters the Abandoned House, advance.

cards.name: The Way In
cards.text:
You open the door to the quaint house and step inside hesitantly. The rooms are mostly bare, and what little furniture remains is covered with dusty white sheets. The whole search seems more futile by the moment until you enter a room whose only furnishing is a large mirror on the mantle above a fireplace. Curiously, the mirror's surface ripples intermittently, and through it you can see an entirely different room. As you approach for a closer look, the scratching of paws on the old wooden floor directs your attention back to the hall behind you. A white rabbit dressed in old Victorian clothing dashes away, clutching a pocket watch and mumbling to itself. You won't get a chance to investigate both before Arkham unravels completely.
The investigators must decide (choose one): - We have to find out what that rabbit is up to. Put the set-aside The White Rabbit into play at Abandoned House. Advance to Act 3a -- Follow the White Rabbit. - We have to figure out how to get inside that mirror. Put the set-aside The Looking-Glass into play at Abandoned House. Advance to Act 3a -- Through the Looking-Glass.

cards.flavor: The white rabbit seems to have the one thing you're looking for amid the constantly twisting landscape: purpose. If there's any method to this madness, you'll find it wherever the rabbit is headed.
cards.name: Follow the White Rabbit
cards.text: Objective - If there are at least 3[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.

cards.name: Down the Rabbit Hole
cards.text:
Following the rabbit is no easy task. It moves rapidly through the unstable terrain without sparing a moment to notice you. You nearly lose track of it in a thick tangle of bushes, but finally catch a glimpse of the rabbit leaping down a hole. You approach the rabbit hole in exasperation, wondering how to proceed, but as you stand there, the hole slowly widens to a much larger and seemingly bottomless pit. You look to the cat for advice, but it merely grins, waiting for you to act. Foolish as it seems, you steel your nerves and leap into the pit.
(→R1)

cards.flavor: If there's anything that's clear about the state of Arkham, it's that Wonderland is the source of it. If you're going to have any real chance of stopping the chaos, you'll have to get to that world through the mirror.
cards.name: Through the Looking-Glass
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no clues on locations: Place 1[per_investigator] clues on Abandoned House from the token bank. Objective - After each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Proceeding Backward
cards.text:
You slowly begin to notice patterns in the distortions sweeping over Arkham. There are moments when the boundaries between the two worlds weaken. You spend some time learning the rhythm and quirks of the distortions before returning to the abandoned house. With proper timing, you leap forward as the mirror's surface ripples, and you pass through it completely as if diving through water.
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
The asylum doesn't have the greatest track record of actually curing their patients. You hope that 
you won't have to leave Alice here for very long.
cards.name: Arkham Asylum
cards.text: [action]: Heal 1 horror (limit once per turn).

cards.flavor:
Splotches of color and bizarre structures coil 
around the gothic building, pressing in on all sides 
and merging haphazardly. You can't hazard 
a guess at just what they might be.
cards.name: Arkham Asylum
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, deal 1 horror to each investigator at Arkham Asylum.

cards.flavor:
The spacious square has few landmarks, due to its popularity as a meeting place, and is largely deserted 
in the early evening, leaving it wide open.
cards.name: Independence Square
cards.text: Investigators at Independence Square get +2 skill value on all tests made on or against cards with the [[Shadow]] trait.

cards.flavor: Dark trees twist upward out of the ground, transforming the open park into a dense tangle of forest. Their boughs mesh together as they grow, blotting out the glow of sunset.
cards.name: Independence Square
cards.text: Investigators at Independence Square get –2 skill value on all tests made on or against cards with the [[Shadow]] trait.

cards.flavor: The bank is nearing its closing hours. Citizens and tellers alike are hoping to hurry through their business, even without the jumbled mess blossoming around the building.
cards.name: Bank of Arkham
cards.text: [reaction] When you take the resource action: gain an additional resource (limit once per turn).

cards.flavor:
The streets around the bank rise up jaggedly, 
cutting into the masonry and spreading like a forest fire. The shapes hardly seem natural, 
but branch off as if alive and growing.
cards.name: Bank of Arkham
cards.text: Investigators at Bank of Arkham cannot gain resources.

cards.flavor: The Arkham Advertiser's staff are frantically at work, cataloguing the strange events sweeping over Arkham. Few of their reporters have returned with information, if any.
cards.name: Newspaper Office
cards.text: [reaction] When you take the draw action: Draw 1 additional card (limit once per turn).

cards.flavor: The checkered tile floor of the newspaper office bends and spirals around you, while chess pieces slide in and around with chaotic, but deliberate motion in a whirling display.
cards.name: Newspaper Office
cards.text: Investigators at Newspaper Office cannot draw cards.

cards.flavor: The shop of habitual oddities seems almost part of the mad transformations outside. The shop is silent but for the muted ticking of a clock on Oliver Thomas' desk.
cards.name: Curiositie Shoppe
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 resource: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an [[Item]] or [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor:
The once-quiet ticking amplifies intensely as 
clock faces and ratcheting gears begin to bleed through 
the various display cases of the shop.
cards.name: Curiositie Shoppe
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Curiositie Shoppe discards the top card of their deck. If that card is a weakness, draw it.

cards.flavor: Northside's train station buzzes with activity and excitement as the setting sun continue to lower. Though it was the first site of Alice's incident, it is currently furthest from its nexus.
cards.name: Train Station
cards.text: [reaction] When you would play an asset: Reduce that asset's cost by 1 (to a minimum of 1, limit once per turn).

cards.flavor:
As the city twists around you, so do the careful 
network of railway tracks flowing in and around 
the station. Boxcars and engines alike lift and begin to propel themselves on this rollercoaster formation.
cards.name: Train Station
cards.text: Forced - When you would play an asset: Increase that asset's cost by 1.

cards.flavor:
The house is almost entirely empty.
It is strangely tranquil amid the chaos outside.
cards.name: Abandoned House

cards.flavor: You don't recall seeing a house at this spot before, or a house like this anywhere in Arkham at all, for that matter.
cards.name: Abandoned House
cards.text: You cannot enter Abandoned House while there are clues on connecting locations.

cards.name: The Looking-Glass
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Abandoned House: Place one of your clues on The Looking-Glass instead. [action] Remove 3 clues from The Looking-Glass: Resign. You step through the looking-glass.

cards.name: The White Rabbit
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, move The White Rabbit to the nearest location without an investigator. [reaction] When you enter The White Rabbit's location: Test [intellect] or [agility] (4). You may spend any amount of clues to get +2 skill value for this test for each clue spent. If you succeed, place 1 clue on the current act (from the token bank). Whether you succeed or fail, move The White Rabbit to the nearest location without an investigator.

cards.name: Panicked Mob
cards.text: Massive. Alert. Forced - If clues are added to Panicked Mob's location or spent by investigators at Panicked Mob's location: Place 1 doom on Panicked Mob. [action] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Deal 2 damage to Panicked Mob.

cards.name: Twisted Citizen
cards.text: Spawn - Location with the most clues. Prey - Investigator with the most clues. If there are no clues on Twisted Citizen's location, it gains hunter. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, if there are any amount of clues on Twisted Citizen's location: Place 1 doom on Twisted Citizen.

cards.name: Abandon Reason
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, attach Abandon Reason to your location and place 1 doom on it. Forced - If Abandon Reason has no doom on it, discard it. [action] Take 1 horror: Remove 1 doom from Abandon Reason.

cards.name: Distorting Influence
cards.text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Distorting Influence attached to your location, then attach Distorting Influence to your location. Otherwise, it gains surge. Investigators at the attached location swap the base values of their [willpower] and [intellect], and the base values of their [combat] and [agility]. [action] Take 1 damage: Discard Distorting Influence.

cards.flavor:
The booklet is filled with a series of strange but
insightful poems, all written completely backward.
cards.name: Looking-Glass Book
cards.text:
Uses (4 poems). If Looking-Glass Book has no poems on it, discard it.
[free] Exhaust Looking-Glass Book and spend 1 poem: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [intellect] for this skill test.

cards.flavor: The odd cake and drink caused you to grow and shrink whenever you used them. This could come in handy.
cards.name: Strange Refreshments
cards.text:
Uses (4 portions). If Strange Refreshments has no portions on it, discard it.
[free] Exhaust Strange Refreshments and spend 1 portion: You get +2 [combat] or +2 [agility] for this skill test.

cards.name: A Sea of Troubles
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1. If you fail, remove 1 oyster from your location.
[cultist]: –3. –5 instead if there are no oysters on your location.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.name: A Sea of Troubles
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2. If you fail, remove 1 oyster from your location.
[cultist]: –4. –6 instead if there are no oysters on your location.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The quiet lapping of waves on the sand does little to calm your feeling of foreboding. Shadows flit in every wave, making you reluctant to enter the surf in search of the truth.
cards.name: A Tide of Tears
The Walrus and the Carpenter
cards.text:
"Problems with the old country house, squire?" A disinterested carpenter approaches the White Rabbit and his partially demolished home, giving them both only a glance. "Yes, yes, only hurry!" the rabbit pleads, tapping his foot. "Easy does it, guv," the carpenter retorts, rubbing his stomach, "Job's as good as done, only I'm a mite peckish. I'll be back 'round once I've had a bite." Further down the rocky coast, an enormous walrus lifts itself out of the surf. Its stomach growls like an earthquake as it looks out over the sea of tears. "Victuals abound. An oyster dinner seems the only solution," it rumbles to itself.
Spawn the set-aside The Walrus into play at Tidal Pools. Spawn the set-aside The Carpenter into play at White Rabbit's House. Shuffle the remainder of the Walrus and Carpenter encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The two hungry figures make their way down the beach with the clear intent of devouring the oysters. With each bite, they seem to grow larger by inches at a time, and at the same time grow darker and more distorted.
cards.name: Beginning the Feed
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase, remove all doom from all cards in play. For each doom removed, resolve the highest possible option 1[per_investigator] times: - Move 1 oyster from The Walrus or The Carpenter's location onto that enemy. - Move The Walrus or The Carpenter one location towards the closest location with the most oysters on it. Forced - If there are no oysters on locations, advance.

cards.name: They'd Eaten Every One
cards.text:
The Walrus and the Carpenter devour the oysters one by one with hardly a pause between them, towering over the beach as they grab oysters by ever-growing handfuls. As the pair gulps down the last of the poor creatures, shadows explode out of them, tearing their bodies to shreds and scoring the coast in the same way that the White Rabbit's house had been destroyed. You flee inland, barely evading the spreading darkness.
Each undefeated investigator who has not resigned takes 1 mental trauma from witnessing the horrific event. (→R1)

cards.flavor: You consider the Cheshire Cat's cryptic words carefully. The cat seemed to suggest not only that the monster that destroyed the White Rabbit's home was one of Gurathnaka's ilk, but also that the nearby oysters may somehow assist in finding and defeating it. If you can destroy this monster, perhaps the same can be done to Gurathnaka in time.
cards.name: Search for the Eldest Oyster
cards.text: Objective - If there are a total of at least 4[per_investigator] oysters in play among all locations, the investigators may advance.

cards.name: Clammed Up
cards.text:
You work your way up and down the coast, but none of the shellfish seem to understand. Finally, one oyster in particular regards you more warily than the others. "You're not part of Wonderland," it states coolly, "but neither are you one of the shadows. You must be another Alice." You do your best to explain the circumstances, and it nods itself slowly.
Choose an investigator to immediately take control of the set-aside The Eldest Oyster asset.

cards.flavor: The oyster demands that you take it with you. "The shadows are hungry, like their master. And anything hungry can be baited. They crave things from your world, some of which have drifted in from the sea of tears." You get the idea pretty quickly to start collecting anything you can find from Arkham.
cards.name: Gone Fishing
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators at Rocky Outcropping may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

cards.name: Catch of the Day
cards.text:
With the wise oyster's guidance, you gather a collection of random flotsam at a small ledge overlooking the sea of tears. "These items are not from Wonderland either," the oyster explains matter-of-factly, "and therefore must be from wherever you are from. The shadows crave things from your home, and with this many, you surely have enough to bait a hook." You tie the debris together and hurl it into the water on a line. No sooner has the cluster hit the water when an enormous shadowy figure erupts from the sea, consuming the objects in a single bite. Bill the lizard gives a terrified wail at the mere sight of the beast, and you do your best to keep him from fleeing as the monster emerges.
Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators went down the rabbit hole, spawn the set-aside Deep Lurker (Perilous Predator) at Rocky Outcropping. Otherwise, spawn the set-aside Deep Lurker (Ravenous Ravager) at Rocky Outcropping.

cards.flavor: The shadowy monster eyes you hungrily and begins to scrabble up the cliff face toward you. Now is your chance to see what weaknesses the greater shadows hold.
cards.name: Abyssal Predator
cards.text: [action] If you are at Deep Lurker's location, spend 1 clue: Fight. This action targets Deep Lurker and uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. If there are 4 or more oysters on your location, this attack deals +1 damage. Objective - If Deep Lurker is defeated, advance.

cards.name: High and Dry
cards.text:
You beat back the savage monster, throwing everything you have at it. After many grueling minutes, the shadowy creature grows unstable, and dissipates with a hollow cry. Bill the lizard's courage finally fails him, and he lets out a panicked yelp. He flees immediately at the awful sound of the shadow's death rattle, leaving you to face its fading form alone.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: The inside of the rabbit's house is bizarrely reminiscent of something.
cards.name: White Rabbit's House
cards.text: [action]: Resign. "This was no day at the beach." There cannot be more than 6 oysters on White Rabbit's House. Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: Place clues on White Rabbit's House from the token bank until there are 1[per_investigator] clues on it. Forced - If there are no clues on White Rabbit's House, in your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Intuition.

cards.flavor: The place seems a bit displaced.
cards.name: White Rabbit's House
Sandy Strand
cards.text:
There cannot be more than 6 oysters on Sandy Strand.
[action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, place 1 resource from the token bank on Sandy Strand as an oyster. If you succeed by 2 or more, place 1 additional oyster on Sandy Strand.

cards.flavor: If only this were cleared away, it would be grand.
cards.name: Sandy Strand
Tidal Pools
cards.text:
There cannot be more than 6 oysters on Tidal Pools.
[reaction] After you succeed at investigating Tidal Pools by 1 or more: Place 1 resource from the token bank on Tidal Pools as an oyster.

cards.flavor: A series of separated pools stand barely in reach of the tide. Miniature ecosystems build and thrive within them.
cards.name: Tidal Pools
Rocky Outcropping
cards.text:
There cannot be more than 6 oysters on Rocky Outcropping.
[action] Choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand: Place X resources from the token bank on Rocky Outcropping as oysters, where X was the amount of cards you discarded. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
A ledge juts out above the sea of tears, though 
the tide still washes shellfish halfway up the rocks.
cards.name: Rocky Outcropping
Sheltered Shallows
cards.text:
There cannot be more than 6 oysters on Sheltered Shallows.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy at Sheltered Shallows: Place X resources from the token bank on Sheltered Shallows as oysters, where X is 1 less than that enemy's health (minimum 1).

cards.flavor:
All manner of fish congregate here in small schools,
but where are the teachers?
cards.name: Sheltered Shallows
Twining Reef
cards.text:
There cannot be more than 6 oysters on Twining Reef.
[action] [action]: Place 2 resources from the token bank on Twining Reef as oysters.

cards.flavor: The coral in this part of the coast weaves together and around itself in complicated loops that don't seem possible.
cards.name: Twining Reef

cards.flavor: "There goes Bill!"
cards.name: Bill the Lizard
cards.text: [free] Exhaust Bill the Lizard: Move Bill the Lizard to any connecting location. Additionally, you may move up to 6 oysters from Bill the Lizard's current location to his new location, not exceeding the maximum for each location. Any investigator at Bill the Lizard's location may activate this ability.

cards.name: The Eldest Oyster
cards.text: [reaction] Exhaust The Eldest Oyster: You get +X skill value for this test, where X is the number of oysters on your location. Any investigator at The Eldest Oyster's location may activate this ability.

cards.name: Deep Lurker
cards.text: Hunter. Massive. Forced - After Deep Lurker is successfully attacked: It gets +1 fight until the end of the round.

cards.name: Deep Lurker
cards.text: Hunter. Massive. Forced - After Deep Lurker is successfully attacked: It gets +1 fight until the end of the round.

cards.name: Pelagic Nightmare
cards.text: Hunter. Spawn - Any [[Coastal]] location. Bill the Lizard cannot be moved to Pelagic Nightmare's location. Forced - After Pelagic Nightmare enters a location, if Bill the Lizard is at that location: Move Bill the Lizard to the connecting location with the lowest shroud.

cards.flavor:
"...and welcomes little fishes in
with gently smiling jaws."
cards.name: Saltwater Crocodile
cards.text: Hunter. Spawn - Any [[Coastal]] location. If there are 3 or more oysters on Saltwater Crocodile's location, it gets +1 fight and +1 damage.

cards.name: Digging for Apples
cards.text: Revelation - Put Digging for Apples into play in your threat area. Forced - When you activate an [action] or [reaction] ability on a location: Spend 2 resources or take 1 damage. [action] If there are 3 or more oysters on your location: Discard Digging for Apples.

cards.flavor:
And this was odd, because it was
the middle of the night.
cards.name: Midnight Sun
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Place 2 of your clues on your location. - Take 2 direct horror.

cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.text: Revelation - Move as many oysters as possible from your location to all connecting [[Coastal]] locations, distributed as evenly as possible. If 1 or fewer oysters were moved by this effect, Tidal Surge gains surge. If 3 or more oysters were moved by this effect, take 1 damage.

cards.name: The Walrus
cards.text: Aloof. The Walrus cannot be damaged. Forced - After The Walrus is successfully attacked: Move up to 1[per_investigator] oysters from The Walrus to its location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: The Carpenter
cards.text: Aloof. The Carpenter cannot be damaged. Forced - After The Carpenter is successfully attacked: Move up to 1[per_investigator] oysters from The Carpenter to his location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The time has come, the Walrus said,
To talk of many things:
cards.name: Of Cabbages and Kings
cards.text: Revelation - If all oysters in play are on the Walrus and/or the Carpenter's locations, Of Cabbages and Kings gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, move X oysters that are not at The Walrus or The Carpenter's location 1 location toward either The Walrus or The Carpenter (whichever is closest), where X is the amount you failed by.

cards.flavor: "I weep for you,' the Walrus said: 'I deeply sympathize."
cards.name: Whetted Appetite
cards.text: Revelation - Put Whetted Appetite into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, The Walrus and The Carpenter attack all investigators at their respective locations in player order. Discard Whetted Appetite.

cards.name: Tempest in a Teapot
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of the current 'c' agenda.
[cultist]: –2. –4 instead if you "have terrible table manners."
[elder_thing]: –3. After this test ends, if you are at a [[Chair]] location, draw the top card of the Seat Deck and replace your location with that card. Shuffle your old location back into the Seat Deck.

cards.name: Tempest in a Teapot
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 2 more than the number of the current 'c' agenda.
[cultist]: –3. –5 instead if you "have terrible table manners."
[elder_thing]: –4. After this test ends, if you are at a [[Chair]] location, draw the top card of the Seat Deck and replace your location with that card. Shuffle your old location back into the Seat Deck.

cards.flavor: The swirling shadows have isolated you on the tea party table and the many chairs orbiting it, none of which seem particularly stable. You will have to work quickly if you are to find your way back to solid ground.
cards.name: Steeped in Shadows
cards.text: Only one investigator or enemy can occupy a [[Chair]] location at once. Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for further details. All enemies lose all spawn instructions and gain "Spawn - Any empty [[Chair]] location."

cards.name: Not Your Cup of Tea
cards.text:
As the chairs cycle in and out, to say nothing of the crazed partygoers that keep appearing at the table, you do your best to avoid being dragged down into the shadows below you. The table grows steadily more raucous as the occupants guzzle down the questionable-looking tea.
Heal 2[per_investigator] damage each from The Hare and The Hatter.

cards.flavor: Each time the chairs float away from the table, they seem to sink further and further from you. If this keeps up, you may soon run out of footing.
cards.name: Drifting in Darkness
cards.text: Only one investigator or enemy can occupy a [[Chair]] location at once. Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for further details. All enemies lose all spawn instructions and gain "Spawn - Any empty [[Chair]] location."

cards.name: Drink and Be Merry
cards.text:
The tea party guests guzzle down their drinks and stuff their faces with any bits of food they can reach as they keep up their nonsensical conversation. This madness is going to get you all killed, if they don't snap out of it.
Heal 2[per_investigator] damage each from The Hare and The Hatter.

cards.flavor: The sparse light illuminating the tea party table is fading fast. If you don't find a way out before the darkness envelops you, there's no telling if you'll ever see daylight again.
cards.name: Minutes to Midnight
cards.text: Only one investigator or enemy can occupy a [[Chair]] location at once. Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for further details. All enemies lose all spawn instructions and gain "Spawn - Any empty [[Chair]] location."

cards.name: Death of the Party
cards.text:
Whatever force was holding the tea party table afloat cannot oppose the grasping shadows any longer. The table and chairs fall away from you, and you can't prevent yourself from falling into darkness.
Each undefeated investigator takes 1 mental or physical trauma (your choice) from being taken by the shadows. (→R1)

cards.flavor: The Hare and Hatter seem quite content to continue their festivities amid the chaos, though they react wildly to any perceived violations of etiquette. They are not only unaware of the shadows, but seemingly unaffected by them as well. What role they have in keeping the tea party afloat is unclear, but you had best proceed with caution in any case.
cards.name: The Mad Tea Party
cards.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. Forced - If The Hare or The Hatter is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Party Foul
cards.text:
If The Hatter was defeated:
The Hatter gives a distressed gurgle and slumps down in his chair as your final blow strikes him. Instantly, the Hare draws upward in a fury and points an accusing finger at you. "If you're going to roughhouse then do it away from the table! I won't have you distressing the other guests!"
Flip The Hare. Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hatter "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 2c -- The Mad March Hare.
If The Hare was defeated:
The Hare collapses limply onto the table as your final attack makes its mark. The Hatter hurls a half-filled teacup at you, utterly livid. "Now you've done it! A perfectly stimulating conversation ruined by your hooliganism! If you can't be civil, then you shouldn't speak at all!"
Flip The Hatter. Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hare "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 2c -- The Mad Hatter.

cards.flavor: The Hare's anger at the death of his friend drives him into a feral state. Nothing you can say or do placates him in the slightest. You will have to continue your attempts at grounding the tea party with this new wrinkle.
cards.name: The Mad March Hare
cards.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. Forced - If The Hare is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Splitting Hares
cards.text:
The Hare tumbles out of his seat, grasping upward feebly as he vanishes into the darkness below. The whole table shudders, rattling the dishes as the shadows close inward on you.
Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hare "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 3c -- An Uncontrolled Party.

cards.flavor: The Hatter is so infuriated by the death of his companion that he can hardly speak, and he stares at you with malice clear in his eyes. You will have to continue your investigations despite his state of fury.
cards.name: The Mad Hatter
cards.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. Forced - If The Hatter is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Hanging Your Hat
cards.text:
The Hatter falls to his knees with a small wail before plummeting down into the roiling shadows. With his disappearance, the darkness seems to close in on you, and the table shakes with a creak of timbers.
Remember that the investigator who defeated The Hatter "has terrible table manners." Advance to Agenda 3c -- An Uncontrolled Party.

cards.flavor: With the Hare and Hatter deceased, the floating tea party grows increasingly unstable. Shadowy tendrils reach in from all sides, attempting to drag the chairs and table apart. You had best make these next minutes count.
cards.name: An Uncontrolled Party
cards.text: Doom cannot be placed on this agenda. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Resign. You leap into the shadows, trusting your intuition. Forced - At the start of the mythos phase, if there are no enemies in play: Place 1 doom on the 'a' agenda.

cards.name: You're Wasting Time!
cards.text:
What are you looking at this side for?
There are more important things you ought to be doing.
Flip this agenda.

cards.flavor: As you struggle to find your footing, your task is already clear. The shadows swept in the moment the Dormouse fell asleep. The problem now, however, is that the table's contents were jumbled when this whole event started. You've got to find the Dormouse at all costs.
cards.name: Mouse Hunt
cards.text: Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for additional movement options.

cards.name: Shell Game
cards.text:
With the table's contents shifting constantly, you devise a way to mark each of the teapots as they cycle past each chair around the table. At long last, you narrow the options down to a single teapot in the middle of the table. Its appearance is different than the one you remember the Dormouse slipping down into, but you know better than to trust your eyes at this point.
Put the set-aside The Dormouse into play at Center of the Table.

cards.flavor: You lift the lid and try to shake the Dormouse awake, but he remains in a deep sleep. Perhaps something at the table here could rouse him. You'll have to pick carefully, however. There's no telling what could be in each teapot or cup.
cards.name: Wake Up Call
cards.text: Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for additional movement options. While The Dormouse is in play and not controlled by any investigator, he gains: "[free] Spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Parley. Take control of The Dormouse. For the remainder of the scenario, The Dormouse does not take up any slots." Objective - If an investigator controls The Dormouse, advance.

cards.name: Tea and Sympathy
cards.text: You find the one cup of tea with a much more pleasing aroma than the others and hold it up to the Dormouse's nose. He stirs lightly at first, then awakens at once with a loud gasp. Panic overtakes him until he sees you looking down at him with concern. "You're... you're here to help...?" he asks you with a quaver in his voice. You nod, and he nods quickly in return. "Help at last... good, good. The things prey on dreams, even within a dream. If you fall asleep, you're as good as a fish in a pot. We've got to drive these shadows away, but we have to anchor the table and chairs back to Wonderland."

cards.flavor: "You've got to tether the chairs at once," the Dormouse commands, "find a way to anchor each one, and the table will return with it." You look back around the table and wrack your brain for a way to accomplish exactly that.
cards.name: Return Trip
cards.text: Consult the Chair Locations section in the campaign guide for additional movement options. [action] If you are at a [[Chair]] location: Test [willpower] (X), where X is total shroud of your location and each connecting [[Chair]] location. You may spend any amount of clues as a group to get +2 [willpower] per clue spent. If you succeed, place a horror token on your location and each connecting [[Chair]] location, as tethers. Locations with tethers cannot leave play or be moved by card effects. Objective - If each [[Chair]] location has a tether on it, advance.

cards.name: Grounded in Fantasy
cards.text:
In each chair, you try to direct your memories towards your adventures in Wonderland thus far. Each image you conjure and event you replay seems to banish a small patch of darkness under each seat. You continue around the table until at last, a ring of grass surrounds the tea party. As if severed, the shadows retreat, and slowly the Hare's garden fades back into vision.
If the current 'c' agenda is The Mad Tea Party, →R2. If the current 'c' agenda is The Mad March Hare, →R3. If the current 'c' agenda is The Mad Hatter, →R4. If the current 'c' agenda is An Uncontrolled Party, →R5.

cards.name: Center of the Table
cards.text: Enemies cannot move to Center of the Table. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase, each investigator at Center of the Table must lose 1 resource or place 1 clue on Center of the Table from the token bank. Forced - After you move to Center of the Table: Remember that you "have terrible table manners." [action] If there are no empty [[Chair]] locations: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy in a [[Chair]] location. That enemy makes an immediate attack against you. Then, discard that enemy and move to its former location.

cards.flavor: Teacups and pots, bread and butter, and no small amount of condiments litter the table in a haphazard fashion.
cards.name: Center of the Table
cards.text: Enemies cannot move to Center of the Table. Forced - After you move to Center of the Table: Remember that you "have terrible table manners."

cards.name: Head of the Table
cards.text: Head of the Table cannot leave play. Head of the Table is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Head of the Table, add clues from the token bank to Head of the Table up to its starting amount. [action]: Place 1 resource on Head of the Table from the token bank, as a tick. If there are 1[per_investigator] ticks on Head of the Table, in your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Patience.

cards.flavor:
An absurdly tall red chair sits at the head of 
the tea-table, occupied by the hosting Hare.
cards.name: Head of the Table
cards.text: Head of the Table cannot leave play.

cards.name: Adirondack Chair
cards.text: Adirondack Chair is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Adirondack Chair, add clues from the token bank to Adirondack Chair up to its starting amount. Then, place 1 clue on each connecting [[Chair]] location.

cards.flavor:
Unoccupied for the moment.
The stains might be tea or jam, or they might not be.

Armchair
cards.text: Armchair is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Armchair, add clues from the token bank to Armchair up to its starting amount. Then, if you do not control any assets that take up at least 1 hand slot: Lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:

Then, you may immediately move a non-[[Elite]] enemy anywhere in play to a [[Chair]] location connected to that location.

Otherwise, if it is not a weakness, discard it.

If that card's cost is higher than Throne's shroud, gain 1 resource. Otherwise, lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor:

The stains might be tea or jam, or they might not be.

Wicker Chair
cards.text: Wicker Chair is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Wicker Chair, add clues from the token bank to Wicker Chair up to its starting amount. Then, if you do not control any assets that take up at least 1 arcane slot: Lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:

Wooden Stool
cards.text: Wooden Stool is connected to the [[Chair]] locations in the clockwise and counter-clockwise directions. Forced - After you enter Wooden Stool, add clues from the token bank to Wooden Stool up to its starting amount. X is equal to the highest number of ammo, supplies, charges, or secrets on an asset you control.

cards.flavor:
Unoccupied for the moment.
The stains might be tea or jam, or they might not be.
cards.name: Empty Seat
The Hare
cards.text: The Hare cannot attack investigators at Center of the Table. Forced - After an investigator damages any other enemy, if The Hare is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hare is already at a connecting location, he attacks instead. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (3) to distract the Hare with a test of strength. If you succeed, automatically evade The Hare.

cards.name: The Hare
cards.text: Forced - After an investigator damages any other enemy, if The Hare is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hare is already at a connecting location, he engages and attacks instead.

cards.name: The Hatter
cards.text: The Hatter cannot attack investigators at Center of the Table. Forced - After an investigator discovers any number of clues, if The Hatter is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hatter is already at a connecting location, he attacks instead. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to distract the Hatter with a riddle. If you succeed, automatically evade The Hatter.

cards.name: The Hatter
cards.text: Forced - After an investigator discovers any number of clues, if The Hatter is ready: He moves once towards that investigator. If The Hatter is already at a connecting location, he engages and attacks instead.

cards.flavor:
A cackling voice sounds from one of the chairs
as another partygoer suddenly appears, 
sipping daintily from a tarry black cup.
cards.name: Demented Guest
cards.text: Forced - After Demented Guest enters a location: Place 1 doom on Demented Guest.

cards.flavor: The wolfish guest eyes the places at the table next to him with genteel manners, but a feral look in his eye.
cards.name: Obsessive Visitor
cards.text:
Hunter.
X is equal to the number of clues on Obsessive Visitor's location and each connecting [[Chair]] location (max 5).

cards.flavor: The old man's headgear resembles a samovar, and he pours himself a cup of tea by bowing his head forward.
cards.name: Teetotaler
cards.text: If you "have terrible table manners," Teetotaler gains retaliate and alert.

cards.name: Bizarre Brew
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - You guzzle down the mysterious drink. Test [combat] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and lose 2 resources. - You refuse to drink from the cup in front of you. Remember that you "have terrible table manners." If you already "have terrible table manners," take 2 horror instead.

cards.name: Change Places!
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - If you are at a [[Chair]] location, swap your location with the furthest possible [[Chair]] location. Each investigator and enemy at these locations is moved along with the locations.

cards.name: Clean Cup!
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Move each investigator and enemy that are in [[Chair]] locations once clockwise or counter-clockwise. All movement happens simultaneously and does not provoke attacks of opportunity. - You refuse to leave your seat. Remember that you "have terrible table manners." If you already "have terrible table manners," take 2 horror instead.

cards.name: Mind Your Manners
cards.text: Revelation - Put Mind Your Manners into your threat area. You cannot activate Parley effects. [free] Discard Mind Your Manners. Remember that you "have terrible table manners." If you already "have terrible table manners," take 2 horror instead. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Mind Your Manners.

cards.flavor: `I told you butter wouldn’t suit the works!’
cards.name: Two Days Wrong
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). If you "have terrible table manners," this test gains peril and +2 difficulty." If you fail, take 1 horror and lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:
Dreams within dreams, 
and none of them quite making sense.
cards.name: The Dormouse
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
[reaction] After you draw a non-weakness card from your deck, exhaust The Dormouse: Shuffle that card back into your deck and draw another card.

cards.name: Bleeding Hearts
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the amount of blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion (rounded up).
[cultist]: –2. –4 instead if The Queen of Hearts is at your location.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion.
[elder_thing]: –2. –4 instead if The Executioner is in play.

cards.name: Bleeding Hearts
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the amount of blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion.
[cultist]: –2. –4 instead if The Queen of Hearts is at your location or a connecting location.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion.
[elder_thing]: –3. –5 instead if The Executioner is in play.

cards.flavor: A case of stolen tarts. You'd laugh if it weren't being pinned on you with the death penalty waiting. The majority of the guards are still allowing you to move about the castle despite the accusations, so you'll have to do your best to not arouse the court's wrath any further.
cards.name: Head Games
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.

cards.name: Chop Chop!
cards.text:
"Haven't you found the culprit yet?! Off with his head!" The Queen's mood is worsening, and the executioner hurriedly sharpens his axe to comply with her wishes.
If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for The Executioner and spawn him normally.

cards.flavor: The Queen stalks the castle grounds on the hunt for a victim. You're beginning to wonder just how much the Queen cares about the tarts, or if she just wants an excuse to execute someone.
cards.name: Scapegoats
cards.text: The Queen of Hearts gains alert. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.

cards.name: Heads Will Roll
cards.text:
Another bellow from the Queen sends the executioner scrambling after you. You've given him the slip a few times already, but he's not about to lose his job over you, or his head for that matter.
If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for The Executioner and spawn him normally.

cards.flavor: If this keeps up, the whole castle will soon be after your head. If you don't make these next few minutes count, then there won't be a chance to redeem yourself.
cards.name: Eliminating Suspects
cards.text: The Executioner and The Queen of Hearts gain alert. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: In player order, each investigator who has 7 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion draws an additional encounter card.

cards.name: Next on the Chopping Block
cards.text:
The sheer number of card guards cut off every possible avenue of escape. Cornered against stone walls with your resources depleted, you stare grimly as the Queen and her executioner approach. "There can be no doubt! Off with their heads this instant!"
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

cards.flavor: The Queen of Hearts seems likely to decapitate everyone in sight if this theft isn't cleared up. First thing's first however, namely getting access to the crime scenes to clear your name. How easy that would be if you weren't the current primary suspect in all this.
cards.name: Lip Service
cards.text: Objective - If 1[per_investigator] or more [[Restricted]] locations are revealed, you must advance.

cards.name: Friends in High Places
cards.text: You manage to ingratiate yourself with the queen's court enough for the guards to ease up on their restrictions. Now that you have access to the more closely-guarded parts of the castle, you can finally make some progress on tracking down the culprit. However, a greater problem has risen to light during your initial scouting of the castle. Shadowy creatures lurk in the darker recesses of the castle, and often found wherever crumbs of the tarts lie scattered. If Gurathnaka's minions are going to attack the castle, they certainly are biding their time.

cards.flavor: While the queen's cronies have been quick about locking down the castle, they certainly haven't been thorough at their investigations. Between the missing tarts and the lurking threat of the shadows, finding the thief seems to be the key to both mysteries.
cards.name: Trail of Tart-crumbs
cards.text: Objective - Only investigators at Hedge Maze may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

cards.name: Caught Red-Mouthed
cards.text:
In a lonely branch of the hedge maze, you are finally able to locate the thief - the Knave of Hearts, as you might have expected. He sits on the grass with half a plate of tarts beside him and some red smudges at the corners of his mouth. Your approach startles the Knave, and he quickly stands to appraise you. "You are neither guard nor card. Good, you can assist in my plan. The tarts were a start, but the Queen must be driven into a greater fury." He leans in toward you to whisper, but keeps a bit of distance still. "I've seen shadowy creatures lurking in the darkest corners of the palace. You've seen them too, haven't you? I know what they can do to people, and I've no desire to follow suit. The trouble is, I can't get at them. Only intense emotions seem to draw them out out of hiding. The Queen's rage should be bait enough, but she must be in a state of rage like never before. I can vandalize the castle to provoke her, but I shall need your assistance."
Put the set-aside The Knave of Hearts into play at Hedge Maze.

cards.flavor: The Knave may not be the most trustworthy person you've met, but the threat of Gurathnaka's shadows consuming the palace has forced your hand.
cards.name: Anger Management
cards.text: [action] If you are at The Knave of Hearts' location, spend 1 clue: Place 1 damage token on your location and move The Knave of Hearts to a connecting location. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Place 1 damage token on your location. [reaction] After The Queen of Hearts enters a location, if there is any amount of damage tokens on that location: Remove all damage tokens from that location and place an equal amount of horror on The Queen of Hearts. Objective - If there is 3[per_investigator] or more horror on The Queen of Hearts, advance.

cards.name: Stay of Execution
cards.text:
Your attempts at provoking the Queen's short temper reach immediate success. Between your direct interference and the Knave's expert sabotage of the castle, the Queen of Hearts has been pushed past her limit. "OFF WITH ALL OF YOUR HEADS!" she blasts, her face red as her own roses as she begins a tantrum. Shadows shift around the castle, reaching toward the queen in the midst of her meltdown.
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
Buckets and brushes lie abandoned by the white rose bushes. 
If the queen is as passionate about her roses as she was 
about her tarts, then you might be able to get in her good 
graces by doing a bit of impromptu gardening.
cards.name: Rose Garden
cards.text: [action] [action] You replant one of the white rose bushes with a red one: Remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. [action] If there is 0 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion: Resign. You flee before anyone else tries to condemn you.

cards.flavor: The royal gardens bristle with bright red flowers of every variety, though you notice a small section of rose bushes that glisten and drip with a coating of red paint.
cards.name: Rose Garden

cards.flavor:
A small group of the queen's courtiers play croquet 
on the open terrace, albeit with flamingos and rolled-up hedgehogs instead of mallets and balls.
cards.name: Croquet Grounds
cards.text: [action]: You try to impress the courtiers to get them on your side. Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion instead.

cards.flavor:
The sounds of laughter coming from the grounds mix
with the squawks and squeaks of distressed animals.
Just what sort of games are being played here?
cards.name: Croquet Grounds

cards.flavor:
Several members of the royal court amble about the maze, 
utterly lost but too proud to admit it. Perhaps you could gain their favor by helping them out of the labyrinth.
cards.name: Hedge Maze
cards.text: [action]: You try to give directions to one of the lost courtiers. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion instead.

cards.flavor:
With how difficult Wonderland has been to navigate,
you can only guess how much more frustrating a
deliberate maze would be.
cards.name: Hedge Maze

cards.flavor:
The eye of scrutiny is definitely strongest here.
The members of the queen's court are all too eager to
gain her favor by getting her angry at someone else.
cards.name: Throne Room
cards.text: Forced - After you discover any number of clues on Throne Room: Add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion or draw the top card of the encounter deck (choose one).

cards.flavor:
Heart motifs decorate every column, arch, and 
banner of the castle. Even the double doors leading to 
the royal audience chamber are heart-shaped.
cards.name: Throne Room

cards.flavor:
The Queen's gardeners are awaiting execution forlornly, but patiently.
If only there was something you could do for the poor doomed cards.
cards.name: Dungeons
cards.text: [reaction] After you evade or defeat The Executioner at this location: Place 1 resource on Dungeons (from the token bank) as a key. Forced - If there are 1[per_investigator] or more keys on Dungeons: in your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Compassion.

cards.flavor:
The castle dungeons are under strict lock and key, 
as you might expect. The sighs and groans of 
languishing prisoners fill the air.
cards.name: Dungeons
cards.text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Dungeons.

cards.flavor:
The jurors sit in their box with chalkboards 
in hand. Perhaps you can influence them 
before any trials get underway.
cards.name: Courtroom
cards.text:
[action] If there are no clues on Courtroom:
Remove up to 4 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion and place the same amount of clues on Courtroom (from the token bank).

cards.flavor: With blame being constantly thrown your way, you don't relish the idea of being in a place that can make it official.
cards.name: Courtroom
cards.text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Courtroom.

cards.flavor:
The kitchens are a mess as the queen's servants ready the tarts. As they haven't cleaned up, there may be some 
evidence left from whoever stole the first set.
cards.name: Kitchens
cards.text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from Kitchens: Remove 2 blame from each investigator's copy of Royal Suspicion (group limit once per game).

cards.flavor:
The smell of freshly-baked tarts slips through the door 
to the royal kitchens. This new batch is being 
closely guarded, and anyone suspected of 
filching the first bunch is not allowed inside.
cards.name: Kitchens
cards.text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Kitchens.

cards.flavor: Most of the card guards are out scouring the castle grounds for the culprit. The few that remain take offense at your intrusion here.
cards.name: Guard Barracks
cards.text: While you are investigating Guard Barracks, if you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, Guard Barracks gains +2 shroud. Forced - When the investigator phase ends: Each investigator at Guard Barracks must discard 1 card from their hand at random.

cards.flavor:
The queen's card guards cross their spears as you approach, highly suspicious of anyone that 
she has accused of thievery.
cards.name: Guard Barracks
cards.text: If there is at least 2 blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, you cannot enter Guard Barracks.

cards.flavor: He puts both the "judge" and "mental" into "judgmental."
cards.name: The King of Hearts
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Move up to 3 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion to a copy of Royal Suspicion controlled by another investigator. Any investigator at The King of Hearts's location may activate this ability. [action] Spend any amount of resources: Parley. For every 3 resources spent, remove 1 blame from your copy of Royal Suspicion. Any investigator at The King of Hearts's location may activate this ability.

cards.name: The Queen of Hearts
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with the most blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion. The Queen of Hearts cannot be damaged. If an investigator at The Queen of Hearts's location has 4 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion, The Queen of Hearts loses aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if The Queen of Hearts is ready: Add 1 blame to each copy of Royal Suspicion controlled by an investigator at The Queen of Hearts's location. Forced - After you successfully attack The Queen of Hearts: she gets –3 evade for the rest of the phase. Add 1 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion.

cards.name: Royal Suspicion
cards.text: Uses (3 blame). Forced - When any effect would add blame to Royal Suspicion: Place resources from the token bank on Royal Suspicion, as blame. Blame has no effect on its own, but other cards may reference the amount of blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion.

cards.name: Corrupt Noble
cards.text: Forced - After Corrupt Noble attacks you: Lose 2 resources. If you cannot lose 2 resources, take 1 horror instead. [action]If you are engaged with Corrupt Noble: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, automatically evade The Queen of Hearts or The Executioner (choose one) and shuffle Corrupt Noble back into the encounter deck. If you fail, place 1 doom on Corrupt Noble.

cards.name: Court Sycophant
cards.text: Spawn - Any connecting location. Forced - When Court Sycophant spawns: Place 1 doom on Court Sycophant or add 2 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion and discard Court Sycophant (choose one).

cards.name: The Executioner
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Spawn - Guard Barracks or Dungeons. Prey - Investigator with the most blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion. If an investigator at The Executioner's location has 4 or more blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion, The Executioner loses aloof. Forced - After damage from The Executioner's attack defeats an investigator or ally: Place 1 doom on him.

cards.name: Damning Evidence
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect cancause the current agenda to advance. - Add 2 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion. - Add 4 blame to another investigator's copy ofRoyal Suspicion.

cards.name: "Off with Their Heads!"
cards.text: Revelation - If The Executioner is in play, place 1 doom on him. Otherwise, search the encounter discard pile and deck for him and spawn him. If you have 4 or more blame on your copy of Royal Suspicion, also place 1 doom on The Executioner.

cards.name: Pointing Fingers
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Choose an investigator and place 1 blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion. If that copy of Royal Suspicion has 4 or more blame on it, place 1 doom on the [[Card]] enemy closest to that investigator. That investigator tests [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of blame on their copy of Royal Suspicion. If they fail, they take 1 horror and lose 1 action.

cards.name: Wrong Place, Wrong Time
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, add 2 blame to your copy of Royal Suspicion. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage. If your copy of Royal Suspicion has 4 or more blame on it, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Have a heart.
cards.name: Executioner's Axe
cards.text: [action] Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [elder_thing] token is revealed during this attack, you may either (choose one): - Treat that token's modifier as 0. - Deal +1 additional damage.

cards.flavor:
If you need to get out of danger quickly,
the Knave might be around or he might not be.
cards.name: The Knave of Hearts
cards.text:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you reveal a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt, exhaust The Knave of Hearts: Cancel that attack or evasion attempt, including all effects of the revealed token. Return each card played or committed during this action to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Wild Snark Chase
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is equal to half the doom on the current agenda (rounded up).
[cultist]: –4. If it is your turn, you may spend 1 action to make this token –2 instead.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail and your location has a horror on it, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: –2. –4 instead if The Jabberwock is in play.

cards.name: Wild Snark Chase
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is equal to 1 + half the doom on the current agenda (rounded up).
[cultist]: –5. If it is your turn, you may spend 1 action to make this token –3 instead.
[tablet]: –4. If your location has a horror on it, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: –3. –5 instead if The Jabberwock is in play.

cards.flavor: Despite the enthusiasm of the Bellman and his party, you have some reservations about searching through these woods in the dark. You get the unsettling feeling that as you search for the Snark, something far stranger and far stronger hunts for you.
cards.name: Twas Brillig
cards.text: [action] Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.

cards.name: An Awful Burbling
cards.text:
The Tulgey Wood reverberates with a horrible noise, an indescribable hissing, gurgling, roaring sound. You don't have to ask what sort of monster could make that noise as you see it hurtling through the woods toward you. It is an enormous loathsome thing with fiery eyes and razor-sharp claws that rend trees apart as it passes. Fear courses through your veins and you have scant seconds to decide whether to run or fight.
Search all play areas and out of play areas (including the victory display) for The Jabberwock and move it to the lead investigator's location. Shuffle the remainder of the set-aside Jabberwocky encounter set into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: "It's the Jabberwock!" the Bellman cries, and rings his bell in wild alarm. The warning doesn't help you in the slightest however, as you are already in the throes of battle with it. The monster swoops and vanishes in its wild attacks, making you wonder just where and when it will strike next. You try to keep up the search while accounting for this added menace, but the Jabberwock's attack has drawn the attention of much darker beings.
cards.name: A Manxome Foe
cards.text: [action] Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.

cards.name: Hast Thou Slain the Jabberwock?
cards.text:
The fiendish creature attacks with increasing frequency and fervor as you attempt to scour the Tulgey Wood. No matter where you turn, the Jabberwock's burning eyes and vicious claws are there to meet you. Even your best attacks leave you wondering if the beast can actually be killed at all.
Search all play areas and out of play areas (including the victory display) for The Jabberwock and move it to the lead investigator's location. If The Jabberwock entered play from the victory display, place 2[per_investigator] damage on it.

cards.flavor: Even without accounting for the menace of the Jabberwock, the expedition's hopes are rapidly dwindling. The motley hunters cower in fear while the Bellman proudly declares that the Bodyguard will see them through yet. You have every intention of doing so, but the growing darkness and ravenous beasts of the wood may prove otherwise.
cards.name: The Trail Grows Cold
cards.text: [action] Take 1 physical trauma and 1 mental trauma: Resign. You break away from the search and hope to find the trail out.

cards.name: Eight Bells
cards.text:
As the Snark hunters grow more separated in their pursuit, the Bellman attempts to keep the group's morale in check. The bell clamors and clangs, but by now, all it can do is attract the attention of the many shadows drawn by the Jabberwock's attack.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

cards.flavor: "Onward to the Snark!" the Bellman shouts as the hunters scatter into the Tulgey Wood. "Search high and low, for a Snark may lurk in any tree or hollow! Once we've gotten our bearings, it's as good as found!" You're not convinced it'll be that easy, or if the creature even resides in these woods at all, but some reconnaissance can't hurt.
cards.name: Babes in the Woods
cards.text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. [action] If there is no horror on your location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Place a horror token on that location (from the token bank). Objective - If there are six revealed [[Tulgey Wood]] locations, advance.

cards.name: Lay of the Land
cards.text:
You and the other Snark hunters report your survey of the immediate area, but the Bellman is occupied with his own discovery. Near the tumtum tree, he stands above a small ditch where a discarded sword lies half-buried in mud. "Bodyguard!" he cries, looking for you, "it's sensible that the Bodyguard should manage all our weaponry for once we've found the Snark. Come collect this one! It should help us threaten the beast into submission!" You oblige the Bellman reluctantly, but are pleasantly surprised to find the weapon of surprisingly good quality and condition.
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside The Vorpal Blade asset. For the remainder of the scenario, this asset does not take up any slots.

cards.flavor: Despite the magnitude of the task and the inexperience of the other hunters, there seems to be some promise of success. All that remains now is to chase the trails wherever they may lead.
cards.name: The Hunting of the Snark
cards.text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. [action] If there is no horror on your location, spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Place a horror token on that location (from the token bank). Objective - When The Snark enters play, advance.

cards.name: Trail's End
cards.text: "Snark ahoy!" the Bellman hollers, "if it should prove no Boojum, then after it with haste!" You hurry toward the commotion and finally catch your first real glimpse of the Snark. Its appearance strikes you as being rather plain compared with the majority of Wonderland's other odd creatures. Could this really be the beast whose talents you need to escape these darkening woods alive?

cards.flavor: "Now's our chance!" the Bellman bellows, "Seek it with thimbles, seek it with care! Pursue it with forks and hope! Threaten its life with a railway-share! Charm it with smiles and soap! Only vary your methods, or the Snark may grow suspicious!"
cards.name: Catchall
cards.text: Investigators at any location may activate The Bellman's abilities. [action] If you are at The Snark's location: Parley. Test any skill (4). If you succeed, place a token on The Snark from the token pool according to the skill used:- If you used [willpower]: 1 horror.- If you used [intellect]: 1 clue.- If you used [combat]: 1 damage.- If you used [agility]: 1 resource. If you fail, move The Snark to a connecting location. Objective - If there are 2[per_investigator] total tokens on The Snark, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: O Frabjous Day!
cards.text:
You try every tactic you can to lure the Snark into capture. After minutes of half-hearted interest, the strange creature finally calms enough for you to approach and lay hands on it. "Masterfully snatched, Bodyguard!" the Bellman cheers, clanging his bell to gather the scattered expedition around.
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
The signs of a monstrous attack are 
etched into the lone tree.
cards.name: Tumtum Tree
cards.text: [action]: Search all play areas and out of play areas for The Jabberwock (including the victory display), ready it, and move it to Tumtum Tree. In your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Courage.

cards.flavor:
The perfect spot for resting and standing in thought.
The Bellman rallies the Snark hunters from the tree, encouraging them with the loud clanging of his bell.
cards.name: Tumtum Tree

cards.flavor:
A number of different nests 
clump together under the sundial.
cards.name: The Wabe
cards.text: [action] If there are no horror and no clues on The Wabe: Place a horror token on The Wabe (from the token bank).

cards.flavor:
Inexplicably, the wood parts in a small clearing 
where a sundial sits in a circle of grass.
cards.name: The Wabe

cards.flavor:
You'll have to repurpose several of 
your supplies to explore here.
cards.name: Field of Chasms
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Field of Chasms: Discard 1[per_investigator] assets from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Field of Chasms (from the token bank).

cards.flavor:
The tall grass forms rings around rocky openings in 
the ground, each leading down several yards.
cards.name: Field of Chasms

cards.flavor:
Scaling the top of the mound will take 
no little amount of skill.
cards.name: Mound of Crags
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Mound of Crags: Discard 1[per_investigator] skills from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Mound of Crags (from the token bank).

cards.flavor: A large hill rises out of the woods, covered on all faces by a network of stony outcroppings and ledges.
cards.name: Mound of Crags

cards.flavor:
Fully exploring the valley 
will take quite a bit of maneuvering.
cards.name: Narrow Valley
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Narrow Valley: Discard 1[per_investigator] events from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Narrow Valley (from the token bank).

cards.flavor: This part of the wood sinks in a deep crevasse, scarcely big enough for a single person to walk down the center of.
cards.name: Narrow Valley

cards.flavor: With the confidence he carries, one might assume that he knows what he's doing.
cards.name: The Bellman
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When a card effect would force you to lose any amount of resources, exhaust The Bellman and deal 1 damage to him: You ignore that part of the effect.
[reaction] When a card effect would force you to discard any amount of cards from your hand, exhaust The Bellman and deal 1 horror to him: You ignore that part of the effect.

cards.name: The Baker's Trail
cards.text:
Your attention is finally drawn to the Baker, who shouts without restraint and waves his arms wildly. "It's a Snark! Callooh! Callay! Our quarry is finally in sight!" The Baker's confirmation sounds too good to be true. Seeing as you've scoured the rest of the Tulgey Wood, however, if a Snark can be found here at all, then the Baker's proclamation might be believed.
Forced - If there is exactly 1 location without horror on it: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.name: The Snark
cards.text: Aloof. Spawn - Location without horror on it. The Snark cannot be engaged, damaged, or defeated.

cards.name: The Banker's Trail
cards.text:
"The Snark resists all attempts at bribery," the Banker muses, "and therefore must be found at the bank of a river." You doubt the connection, but the watery footprints you find along the river are proof enough to continue the chase here
Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Banker's pursuit ends at the banks of
a dangerous series of river rapids.
cards.name: Lonely Backwoods
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Spend a total of 3[per_investigator] resources from among all investigators' resource pools at this location. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Barrister's Trail
cards.text:
"The Snark must be somewhere deep and lonely," the Barrister speculates, "Or it would have answered the summons I sent it." You're not certain of the Snark's ability to read at all, but the strange noises emanating from a nearby cavern give reason enough to search it.
Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Barrister's course winds through
a claustrophobic series of tunnels.
cards.name: Lonely Backwoods
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search your deck and discard pile for a weakness and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Beaver's Trail
cards.text:
"I tailed the Snark, but mine fell flat," the Beaver grumbles, holding its flat tail, "Its own tail must be frought with danger." The woods are already filled with danger, but at the Beaver's insistence, you proceed toward a shadowy and isolated valley.
Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Beaver's directions lead to
a particularly dark and dismal chasm.
cards.name: Lonely Backwoods
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 treachery that does not have surge (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players) and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Billiard-Maker's Trail
cards.text:
"It's taken our cue," the Billiard-Maker bemoans, dusting off his hands, "and so it will want chalk to dust the tip, from somewhere rocky, I presume." His theory seems far-fetched at best, but you can't deny the trail of white powder leading down the rocks.
Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Billiard-Maker's chase requires you to bridge
a vast canyon by whatever means you can.
cards.name: Rough Hinterlands
cards.text: [action]: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test any skill (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Bonnet-Maker's Trail
cards.text:
"No arrangement could be made to satisfy the beast!" the Bonnet-Maker despairs, "If it refuses a bonnet, then it must be indoors!" You hold your tongue at the notion, but the echoes of some strange beast from a secluded cave cause you to reconsider.
Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Bonnet-Maker's path leads to 
the entrance of a deep and eerie cave.
cards.name: Rough Hinterlands
cards.text: [action]: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Boots' Trail
cards.text:
"We've bared our soles in this chase," the Boots grumbles, staring at a hole in his shoe, "And yet the Snark hasn't worn out its own shoes. It must be climbing instead." The assumption doesn't seem quite right to you, though you spot movement atop a nearby cliff.
Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Boots' route directs you to
a small ledge atop a sheer cliff face.
cards.name: Rough Hinterlands
cards.text: [action]: If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Test [agility] (2). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Broker's Trail
cards.text:
"We must search both high and low," the Broker declares, "but let us start low for the sake of our stock." Though the premise is flawed, this still leads you toward soft mud and bent plants that betray the passage of some creature very recently.
Forced - If there are exactly 3 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Broker's track treads over marshy ground
that severely limits your options.
cards.name: Rough Hinterlands
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Rough Hinterlands: Discard cards with total cost of 3[per_investigator] from among all investigators' hands at this location. Place a horror token on Rough Hinterlands (from the token bank).

cards.name: The Butcher's Trail
cards.text:
"The Snark has cut and run," the Butcher declares, "We've sent it packing, and so it must have returned to its pack." You don't recall anything about Snarks being social creatures, but you are drawn to a nearby grove by a jumble of strange sounds.
Forced - If there are exactly 2 locations without horror on them: Flip this card and put it into play.

cards.flavor:
The Butcher's detour passes by a hollow tree 
occupied by a variety of agitated creatures.
cards.name: Lonely Backwoods
cards.text: [action] If there is no horror on Lonely Backwoods: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy that does not have surge (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players) and draw it. Place a horror token on Lonely Backwoods (from the token bank).

cards.flavor: You've never seen something so frumious before.
cards.name: Bandersnatch
cards.text: Hunter. Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. If Bandersnatch moved during the enemy phase, it does not attack. Forced - When an investigator enters Bandersnatch's location: It readies, engages, and attacks that investigator.

cards.flavor: This one looks particularly mimsy.
cards.name: Borogrove
cards.text: Surge. Hunter. Aloof. Forced - When any amount of damage would be dealt to another enemy at Borogrove's location: Deal that damage to Borogrove instead.

cards.flavor: Desperate and in perpetual passion.
cards.name: Jubjub Bird
cards.text: Hunter. Aloof. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Jubjub Bird is ready and unengaged: It attacks each investigator at its location in player order.

cards.flavor: The only creature that could outgribe this loudly.
cards.name: Mome Rath
cards.text:
Retaliate.
If there is a horror on Mome Rath's location, it gets +2 fight and +1 horror.

cards.flavor: Gyring and gimbling away.
cards.name: Slithy Tove
cards.text: Hunter. Alert. Forced - After Slithy Tove is successfuly evaded: Move it to a connecting location and ready it.

cards.name: Going in Circles
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Remove a horror from any location, thenadd 1[per_investigator] clues to that location (from the token bank).

cards.name: Looking-Glass Swarm
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, put Looking-Glass Swarm into play in your threat area. Your attacks cannot deal more than 1 damage. You cannot discover more than 1 clue while investigating. [action] [action]: Discard Looking-Glass Swarm.

cards.flavor: 'One, two! One, two! And through and through!'
cards.name: The Vorpal Blade
cards.text: [action] Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [elder_sign], [bless], +1, or 0 token is revealed during this attack, you may either heal 1 horror or deal an additional +1 damage (choose one, if your target has the [[Monster, Abomination,]] or [[Shadow]] traits, you may chose both instead).

cards.name: The Jabberwock
