cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. The Jabberwock gets +1 damage and +1 horror during the enemy phase. Forced - At the end of the round, disengage The Jabberwock from all investigators and move it and all tokens on it next to the agenda deck, out of play.

cards.name: Claws That Catch
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if The Jabberwock is in play. If you fail, take 1 damage and lose 2 resources.

cards.name: Eyes of Flame
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if The Jabberwock is in play. If you fail, take 1 horror and discard 2 cards from your hand at random.

cards.name: Whiffling Through the Wood
cards.text: Revelation - If The Jabberwock is in the victory display, Whiffling Through the Wood gains surge. Otherwise, if the Jabberwock is out of play, put it into play at your location. If the Jabberwock is already in play, deal 1 damage and 1 horror to all investigators at its location, then move it to your location.

cards.name: Sibling Rivalry
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1. –3 instead if there are at least 1[per_investigator] total tokens on the scenario card.
[cultist]: –2. –4 instead if there is not an equal number of damage and horror tokens on the scenario card.
[elder_thing]: –2. If you fail, place 1 damage token and 1 horror token on the scenario card.

cards.name: Sibling Rivalry
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2. –4 instead if there are at least 1[per_investigator] total tokens on the scenario card.
[cultist]: –3. –5 instead if there is not an equal number of damage and horror tokens on the scenario card.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, place 1 damage token and 1 horror token on the scenario card.

cards.flavor: Acting on the Tweedles' orders, the cards and chess pieces clash with each other on every available point in the small wooded valley. At the rate this battle is escalating, the soldiers might actually kill one of the Tweedles before you can get the rattle.
cards.name: Brother Against Brother
cards.text: Forced - When a [[Card]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 damage token on the scenario card (from the token bank). Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 horror token on the scenario card (from the token bank).

cards.name: Tit for Tat
cards.text:
With the slight shifting of the flow of combat, one of the soldiers gets an opportunity to storm the opposing hill and attack the dismayed twin on it.
Count the damage and horror tokens on the scenario card and resolve the following: - If there are more damage tokens on the scenario card than horror tokens and Tweedledum is in play: Deal 1 damage to Tweedledum. - If there are more horror tokens on the scenario card than damage tokens and Tweedledee is in play: Deal 1 damage to Tweedledee. - Otherwise: Deal 1 damage to either Tweedledum or Tweedledee (choose one in play). If no resolution was reached through this effect, remove all tokens from the scenario card. Then, flip this agenda.

cards.flavor: To end the pointless war between Tweedledum and Tweedledee and get that rattle, you're going to have to be creative, especially if you don't want to just kill one of them. Unfortunately, the massive amounts of cards and chess pieces recruited by the Tweedles are bogging down any plans you've devised.
cards.name: Thinning the Ranks
cards.text: Objective - If there are no enemies in play, advance.

cards.name: Need-to-Know Basis
cards.text: The twins' armies are almost as evenly matched as they themselves are. Every soldier of theirs that you cut down swings the balance of the battle in the favor of the other. However, with fewer soldiers blocking your movements, you can focus on figuring out how to bring an end to the battle.

cards.flavor: As the battle drags on, the shadows initially banished by the rattle have begun to creep back toward the valley. You think on the childish personalities of the Tweedles and their old nursery rhyme, and you wonder if you can somehow focus the shadows to scare them out of their duel.
cards.name: Scare Tactics
cards.text: Objective - Only investigators at Overgrown Dell may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

cards.name: A Pound of Feathers
cards.text:
At first it seems to be impossible to corral the shadows toward any specific part of the battlefield. However, on the sloped terrain around the battlefield, you find several fallen crow feathers that seem to draw nearby shadows toward them. You gather as many as you can find and collect them in the central valley. Within minutes, darkness begins to coalesce around the bundle of feathers and expand into an enormous shape. You take several steps back and cover your ears as the unearthly cawing of an unnatural crow screams out from the growing darkness. Tweedledum and Tweedledee stop barking orders at their minions and stand in frightened awe as the shadowy crow takes shape.
Put the set-aside Monstrous Crow into play next to the agenda deck.

cards.flavor: The Tweedles are already panicking, but still attempting to marshal their troops into action. With the shadowy crow bearing down on the battlefield, you have the tool you need to scare some sense into the twins.
cards.name: As the Crow Flies
cards.text: [action] If you are at the same location as Tweedledum or Tweedledee: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, place 1 horror on an uncontrolled story asset at your location. Objective - If Tweedledum (Terrified Twin) and Tweedledee (Terrified Twin) are both in the victory display, advance.

cards.name: Eating Crow
cards.text:
The Tweedles' nerves were failing them at the crow's appearance, but your added fearmongering sends them screaming and scrambling away from the battle. Without their leaders, the cards and chess pieces have no further driving force, and amble away from the valley harmlessly. Satisfied, you grab the last discarded piece of the rattle and turn your attention up to the shadowy crow.
(→R5)

cards.flavor:
The card and chess soldiers clash around you,
 obeying the orders of the twins. If only you could 
convince them to give up this ridiculous duel.
cards.name: Overgrown Dell
cards.text: [action] If there are at least 2[per_investigator] total tokens on the scenario card: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, in your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Reason.

cards.flavor: Fallen logs and tangling weeds collect at the bottom of this small valley. This doesn't seem to deter the cards and chess pieces marching down from the opposing hills.
cards.name: Overgrown Dell

cards.flavor:
The bulk of Tweedledum's forces waits here for 
an opportunity to get into the fray.
cards.name: West Hill
cards.text: [action] Parley: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to convince one of Tweedledum's playing cards to abandon the fight. If you succeed, place 1 damage token on the scenario card. If you fail, take 1 damage instead.

cards.flavor: Tweedledum stands atop this hill, looking angrily out across the valley toward his brother with his arms folded.
cards.name: West Hill

cards.flavor:
The bulk of Tweedledee's forces waits here for 
an opportunity to get into the fray.
cards.name: East Hill
cards.text: [action] Parley: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to convince one of Tweedledee's chess pieces to abandon the fight. If you succeed, place 1 horror token on the scenario card. If you fail, take 1 horror instead.

cards.flavor:
Tweedledee stands atop this hill, sulking with
his fists on his hips in a show of discontentment.
cards.name: East Hill

cards.flavor:
The cards raise their spears as you approach,
guarding the ascent to the hill carefully.
cards.name: Northwest Slope
cards.text: If there are at least 2 more damage tokens than horror tokens on the scenario card, you cannot investigate Northwest Slope.

cards.flavor:
The path up the north side of Tweedledum's hill 
is packed with cards all clamoring to get 
down into the central valley. You may not be able 
to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Northwest Slope

cards.flavor:
The card guards form into orderly ranks 
to prepare for their march down the slopes.
cards.name: Northwest Slope
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, heal 1 damage from each [[Card]] enemy at Northwest Slope.

cards.flavor:
The path up the north side of Tweedledum's hill 
is packed with cards all clamoring to get 
down into the central valley. You may not be able 
to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Northwest Slope

cards.flavor:
The chess pieces group together as you approach,
carefully gauging your loyalty in this fight.
cards.name: Northeast Slope
cards.text: If there are at least 2 more horror tokens than damage tokens on the scenario card, you cannot investigate Northeast Slope.

cards.flavor:
The path up the north side of Tweedledee's hill is swarming with chess pieces determined to join battle.
You may not be able to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Northeast Slope

cards.flavor:
The horde of chess pieces rally here 
for their assault on the central valley.
cards.name: Northeast Slope
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, heal 1 damage from each [[Chess]] enemy at Northeast Slope.

cards.flavor:
The path up the north side of Tweedledee's hill is swarming with chess pieces determined to join battle.
You may not be able to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Northeast Slope

cards.flavor:
The chess pieces mustered here seem particularly tense.
It might be easy getting them to panic.
cards.name: Southwest Slope
cards.text: [reaction] After a [[Chess]] enemy is defeated at Southwest Slope: This location gets –3 shroud until the end of the round (group limit once per round).

cards.flavor:
The path up the south side of Tweedledum's hill is overflowing with cards rushing down to the valley.
You may not be able to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Southwest Slope

cards.flavor: The cards here bolster their forces to make up for any shortcomings on other parts of the battlefield.
cards.name: Southwest Slope
cards.text: While there are more damage tokens on the scenario card than horror tokens, Southwest Slope gets +2 shroud.

cards.flavor:
The path up the south side of Tweedledum's hill is overflowing with cards rushing down to the valley.
You may not be able to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Southwest Slope

cards.flavor:
The cards assaulting this slope aren't very cohesive.
It might be easier than you expected to drop their guard.
cards.name: Southeast Slope
cards.text: [reaction] After a [[Card]] enemy is defeated at Southeast Slope: This location gets –3 shroud until the end of the round (group limit once per round).

cards.flavor:
The path up the south side of Tweedledee's hill is practically bursting with chess pieces, all eager to fight.
You may not be able to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Southeast Slope

cards.flavor: The chess pieces here have a more fortified position to balance any losses suffered across the valley.
cards.name: Southeast Slope
cards.text: While there are more horror tokens on the scenario card than damage tokens, Southeast Slope gets +2 shroud.

cards.flavor:
The path up the south side of Tweedledee's hill is practically bursting with chess pieces, all eager to fight.
You may not be able to get back down the way you came.
cards.name: Southeast Slope
Tweedledee
cards.text: [action]: Deal 3 damage to Tweedledee. Any investigator at Tweedledee's location may activate this ability. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - If there is 1[per_investigator] horror on Tweedledee: Flip Tweedledee and move him to the victory display. Forced - If Tweedledee is defeated by damage: (→R2).

cards.flavor:
Just then flew down a monstrous crow,
As black as a tar-barrel!
Which frightened both the heroes so,
They quite forgot their quarrel.
cards.name: Tweedledee
Tweedledum
cards.text: [action]: Deal 3 damage to Tweedledum. Any investigator at Tweedledum's location may activate this ability. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - If there is 1[per_investigator] horror on Tweedledum: Flip Tweedledum and move him to the victory display. Forced - If Tweedledum is defeated by damage: (→R2).

cards.flavor:
Just then flew down a monstrous crow,
As black as a tar-barrel!
Which frightened both the heroes so,
They quite forgot their quarrel.
cards.name: Tweedledum
Monstrous Crow
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, Monstrous Crow attacks each investigator in player order, regardless of location. Investigators as a group may spend 1 clue to cancel an attack made against any investigator.

cards.name: Caught in the Fray
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] or [agility] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. For each [[Card]] enemy discarded, take 1 damage and lose 1 resource. For each [[Chess]] enemy discarded, take 1 horror and discard a card from your hand at random.

cards.name: Contested Area
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Contested Area to your location. Forced - When an enemy would spawn at or enter the attached location: Place 1 doom on that enemy. [action]: Test [intellect] or [combat] (4). If you succeed, discard Contested Area.

cards.flavor: The shadows are getting tired of lurking.
cards.name: Dark Interference
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Search the encounter deck for a [[Soldier]] enemy. You must either (choose one): - Spawn that enemy at a [[Slope]] location (empty if possible) with 1 doom on it. - Discard that enemy, then take 1 damage and 1 horror. After resolving this effect, shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.name: Gaining Ground
cards.text: Revelation - Resolve whichever is true: - If there is more damage on Tweedledum than on Tweedledee: Place 1 damage on the scenario card, then take 1 damage. - If there is more damage on Tweedledee than on Tweedledum: Place 1 horror on the scenario card, then take 1 horror. - If there is an equal amount of damage on both Tweedledum and Tweedledee: Place 1 damage and 1 horror on the scenario card, then take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: Priority Target
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If there are no [[Soldier]] enemies in play, Priority Target gains surge. Otherwise, attach Priority Target to a [[Soldier]] enemy in play. The attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +2 health, and gains the [[Elite]] trait.

cards.flavor: As good as new.
cards.name: Tweedles' Rattle
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Tweedles' Rattle: Investigate. Ignore all effects that increase your location's shroud for this test. [action] Exhaust Tweedles' Rattle: Evade. If your target has the [[ Monster, Abomination,]] or [[Shadow]] traits, you get +2 [agility] for this test.

cards.name: Fool's Mate
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of [[Chess]] enemies in play (to a maximum of 5).
[cultist]: –2. If this token is revealed during a fight or evade attempt against a [[Chess]] enemy, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: –1. –3 instead if you are at a [[Shadow]] location.

cards.name: Fool's Mate
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of [[Chess]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: –3. If this token is revealed during a fight or evade attempt against a [[Chess]] enemy, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: –2. –4 instead if you are at a [[Shadow]] location.

cards.flavor: Your arrival on the front lines spurs movement from the far side of the board. If any truce was maintained until now, the time for it has passed.
cards.name: Opening Strategy
cards.text: [[Chess]] enemies gain hunter and "Spawn - Seventh Row or Eighth Row." Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.

cards.name: Blitz Chess
cards.text:
Your preparations to cross the center line have been carefully observed. The red pieces storm out from the darkened castle. You have noticed from the first attackers that the pieces still somehow obey what you would consider normal chess rules. Is the Red King still guiding their movements? Or is it such a core part of the pieces that they move instinctively?
Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a King's Shadow and spawn it at the lead investigator's location. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.

cards.flavor: The battle on the chess fields continues with increasing fervor. Red pieces flow out from the darkened half of the board with surprising speed to meet your approach.
cards.name: Countergambit
cards.text: [[Chess]] enemies gain hunter and "Spawn - Seventh Row or Eighth Row." Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.

cards.name: Gardez la Reine
cards.text:
The red pieces pause their fighting to bow and kneel as an imposing figure emerges from the shadowy veil. The Red Queen, her face somehow both hard and soft at once, gazes hatefully across the fields at you as power swells within her. Shadows pour from her robes, and she begins to mutate further. "Strike down the invaders!" she bellows, racing toward you with tremendous speed.
If The Red Queen is not in play or in the victory display, spawn her at Eighth Row.

cards.flavor: As the Red Queen advances upon you, the shadows spread with the speed of a wildfire toward the white castle. Darkness begins to claw at the sky, and each piece of landscape appears like a blackened copy of itself.
cards.name: File Occupation
cards.text: [[Chess]] enemies gain hunter and "Spawn - Seventh Row or Eighth Row." Forced - When a [[Chess]] enemy would resolve the hunter keyword, consult the Chess Movement section in the campaign guide.

cards.name: Domination
cards.text:
The red army relentlessly presses back against your charge in a seemingly unending flow of soldiers. As they push back, the amassed shadows sweep past you towards the castle of the white chess pieces and crash against it like a tidal wave. Your fighting for conquest turns to a fight for survival as you flee the battlefield.
Each undefeated investigator who has not resigned takes 1 physical trauma from fighting off the red army. (→R1)

cards.flavor: You can barely make out the silhouette of the Red King's castle amid the darkened clouds ahead of you. It will be quite an ordeal to make it across the ruined half of the chess board fields.
cards.name: Across the Board
cards.text: [action]: Move an unengaged [[Chess]] enemy according to its movement rules in the campaign guide. Objective - When an investigator enters the Eighth Row, advance.

cards.name: King's Castle
cards.text:
Through the swirling darkness, you charge up the steps of the red castle and burst through the towering double doors. The Red King sits at the opposite end of a grand hall, seated languidly in a grand skeletal throne. He does not make any motion as you enter, though the shadows leaking out of his hooded cloak begin to pour with increasing volume.
Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators went through the looking-glass, spawn the set-aside The Red King (Obscure Overlord) at Eighth Row. Otherwise, spawn the set-aside The Red King (Tenebrous Tyrant) at Eighth Row. If The Red Queen is not in play or in the victory display, spawn her at Eighth Row.

cards.flavor: The Red King utters no commands or cries of alarm, but his minions pursue you into the castle as the shadows try to blot the light out behind you. Your only recourse is triumph, here and now.
cards.name: Absolute Pin
cards.text: [action]: Move an unengaged [[Chess]] enemy according to its movement rules in the campaign guide. Objective - If The Red King is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Pawn Takes King
cards.text:
You strike the Red King with every bit of courage you can muster, and all at once, the red pieces freeze and the shadows' advance halts. The entire area seems suspended in time for a moment before the king slips down out of his throne and splays on the floor before you.
(→R2).

cards.flavor:
The White King does his best to rally his pieces 
into action, but they largely ignore him.
cards.name: First Row
cards.text: [action]: Resign. "This is a losing game." [action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror (limit once per game).

cards.flavor: The majority of the white chess pieces cluster inside the white castle, hesitant but clearly worried as they gaze down towards the shadowy far side of the board.
cards.name: First Row

cards.flavor: The outer walls of the white chess pieces offer some protection against the attacking red pieces.
cards.name: Second Row
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move the evaded enemy to either the Third Row or the Fourth Row.

cards.flavor: The white chess pieces' fortifications end at this square. Beyond lies an open battlefield.
cards.name: Second Row

cards.flavor:
The third row is open and spacious, with many
well-kept roads running through it.
cards.name: Third Row
cards.text: [reaction] After you move to this location as your first action: Move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
The wide fields are perfectly square, 
though dense hedge rows block your path to 
any other column of this chess board.
cards.name: Third Row

cards.flavor:
A white knight roams near the border of 
the fifth row, muttering to himself in confusion.
cards.name: Fourth Row
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Fourth Row: Put the set-aside The White Knight into play at this location and shuffle both set-aside copies of Absent-Minded into the encounter deck. [free] Discard the top card of your deck: Shuffle any other card from your discard pile back into your deck (limit once per round).

cards.flavor: The sun shines down in scattered rays as the darkness from the far half of the board begins reaching across.
cards.name: Fourth Row

cards.flavor: Your body seems to fight you with each step forward, as if your own shadow were pulling back on you.
cards.name: Fifth Row
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Fifth Row: Reveal the top five cards of your deck and draw each weakness revealed. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor:
A deep split in the field separates the fourth 
and fifth rows. Shadows churn at the bottom, 
making it uncertain just how deep it is.
cards.name: Fifth Row
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Fifth Row, investigators must spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group.

cards.flavor:
Shadows coil in from the sides of the square,
as if trying to hedge you in.
cards.name: Sixth Row
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Sixth Row: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, immediately end your turn.

cards.flavor:
The terrain grows rougher with each
step you take into enemy territory.
cards.name: Sixth Row
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Sixth Row, investigators must spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group.

cards.flavor:
You find it hard to keep your footing as you 
make your way across the dim landscape and 
through the broken defenses of the red chess pieces.
cards.name: Seventh Row
cards.text: Forced - When you reveal Seventh Row: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Chess]] enemy and spawn it engaged with an investigator at this location. If you searched the encounter deck, shuffle it.

cards.flavor:
The outer fortifications of the red chess 
pieces lie crumbling, though the many corrupted 
pieces still lurk within them.
cards.name: Seventh Row
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Seventh Row, investigators must spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group.

cards.flavor: The castle of the red king lies in ruins at the edge of a massive cloudy void, torn apart unevenly by hungry claws.
cards.name: Eighth Row
cards.text: Forced - While there are 1[per_investigator] or fewer clues at this location, as an additional cost to investigate this location: Choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
A roiling blanket of darkness 
veils the final square almost completely.
cards.name: Eighth Row
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Eighth Row, investigators must spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group.

cards.flavor:
The Cheshire Cat might be offended 
if you mention curiosity killing anything.
cards.name: Distant Square
cards.text: Revelation - In your Campaign Log, under "Fragments of Alice," record Curiosity. Investigators cannot enter Distant Square. [free] If The White Knight is on Distant Square, deal 1 horror to him: Ready The White Knight and move him to any revealed location. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: You can spot chess pieces moving to this square out of the corner of your eye, but it seems a world away.
cards.name: Distant Square
cards.text:
Investigators cannot enter Distant Square.
[action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Reveal Distant Square. Investigators as a group may activate this ability from any location.

cards.name: The White King
cards.text:
[reaction] After you take the draw action, exhaust The White King: Draw 1 additional card. Any investigator at The White King's location may activate this ability.
[reaction] After you take the resource action, exhaust The White King: Gain 2 additional resources. Any investigator at The White King's location may activate this ability.

cards.name: The Red King
cards.text: Alert. The Red King cannot make attacks of opportunity during investigate actions. While there are more than 1[per_investigator] clues on Eighth Row, The Red King gets +2 fight and retaliate. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues from Eighth Row: Deal X damage to The Red King where X is the amount of clues they discovered.

cards.name: The Red King
cards.text: Alert. The Red King cannot make attacks of opportunity during investigate actions. While there are more than 1[per_investigator] clues on Eighth Row, The Red King gets +2 fight and retaliate. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues from Eighth Row: Deal X damage to The Red King where X is the amount of clues they discovered.

cards.flavor: "...all she remembers is, that they were running hand in hand, and the Queen went so fast that it was all she could do to keep up with her: and still the Queen kept crying ‘Faster! Faster!’"
cards.name: The Red Queen
cards.text: Prey - Lowest [agility]. While you are engaged with The Red Queen, you cannot activate [free] effects or play cards with the fast keyword.

cards.flavor: "There he goes! Right on his head as usual!"
cards.name: Absent Minded
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Exhaust The White Knight and move him to Distant Square.

cards.name: King's Shadow
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. King's Shadow cannot be engaged. Forced - When you would leave King's Shadow's location: King's Shadow attacks you. [reaction] After you successfully investigate or discover clues from your location: Deal 1 damage to King's Shadow.

cards.name: Discovered Attack
cards.text: Revelation - Put Discovered Attack into play in your threat area. Forced - After you enter an enemy's location or an enemy enters your location: Place 1 doom on that enemy. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, discard Discovered Attack.

cards.name: Overextended
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if you are at a [[Shadow]] location. If you fail, take 1 damage (2 damage instead if there is a [[Chess]] enemy at your location). If you failed by 2 or more, lose 2 resources.

cards.name: Promotion
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If there are no [[Chess Soldier]] enemies in play, Promotion gains surge. Otherwise, choose a [[Chess Soldier]] enemy and attach Promotion to it. The attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, and +1 horror. If the attached enemy is a Pawn, it gets an additional +1 fight, +2 health, and +1 evade.

cards.name: Zugzwang
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Zugzwang to your location. Forced - When you would leave attached location, you must (choose two different options): - Take 1 damage. - Take 1 horror. - Discard 1 card from hand at random. - Lose 1 resource. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Zugzwang.

cards.name: The White Knight
cards.text: Investigators at The White Knight's location get +1 to all skills when resolving effects or during attack, evasion, or investigate attempts on or against [[Chess]] cards. [action] Parley: Move The White Knight to a connecting location. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if The White Knight is ready and at Distant Square: Move him to any investigator's location.

cards.name: Lucid Nightmare
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –2. –4 instead if there is more total damage and horror on Alice than on your investigator.
[cultist]: –2. –4 instead if you are at a [[Wonderland]] or [[Shadow]] location.
[tablet]: –2. –4 instead if there are 3 or fewer [[Wonderland]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: –2. If Gurathnaka is at your location, reveal another token.

cards.name: Lucid Nightmare
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –3. –5 instead if there is more total damage and horror on Alice than on your investigator.
[cultist]: –3. –5 instead if you are at a [[Wonderland]] or [[Shadow]] location.
[tablet]: –3. –5 instead if there are 3 or fewer [[Wonderland]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: –3. If Gurathnaka is at your location, reveal another token.

cards.flavor: The stability of Arkham continues to degrade as it had when you first entered Wonderland. Darkness spreads from the north half of the city, and with it, Gurathnaka and its minions. Shadows greedily consume everything in their path like a forest fire, gorging and growing steadily stronger.
cards.name: Burgeoning Darkness
cards.text: Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat. Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators. Forced - If Alice is defeated, (→R2).

cards.name: Psychological Warfare
cards.text:
Alice leans against a partially demolished building as another ungodly roar rips through the air. Her efforts are slowing the shadows from crossing over into Arkham, but her body and spirit are being quickly overtaxed.
Deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice. If resolving this effect would defeat Alice: (→R2).

cards.flavor: Gurathnaka leads its shadows in consuming any and all material they can claw apart; animal, vegetable, or mineral. A dark void radiates out in their wake, emptier even than the void of space.
cards.name: Mass Consumption
cards.text: Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat. Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators. Forced - If Alice is defeated, (→R2).

cards.name: The Mind Recoils
cards.text:
Reality wavers and ripples inconstantly, unbalancing you in its shifting state. You rise quickly, but Alice takes several more moments to push herself unsteadily back up. If the shadows grow in strength much further, then Alice may not survive the strain.
Deal 2 damage and/or horror to Alice. If resolving this effect would defeat Alice: (→R2).

cards.flavor: The fading glow of twilight and the few remaining street lights in Arkham light your way as you hurry as never before. When darkness overtakes the city, it will be the end not only for you, but all life on Earth.
cards.name: Last Light
cards.text: Alice Liddell cannot take control of the Cheshire Cat. Enemies cannot engage, attack, or target Alice Liddell when moving via the hunter keyword. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move Gurathnaka one location towards the location with the most investigators. Forced - If Alice is defeated, (→R2).

cards.name: The Dead of Night
cards.text:
The sharp popping and shattering of glass sounds over the rumble of the crumbling landscape. With all now artificial light gone, you can only watch in despair as the fading glow of twilight darkens to night and the shadows claw at you from all sides.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated.

cards.flavor: Shards and echoes of Wonderland pervade the familiar districts of Arkham. The only way you will be able to banish the shadows is to purge the parts of the city overlapping with Alice's dreams. It is finally time for you to leverage what you learned in your journey.
cards.name: Separating Fantasy
cards.text: Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: The investigators as a group must choose and play one card from Alice's hand. Then, you may move Alice to any connecting location. [reaction] After you successfully attack Gurathnaka: Discover a clue at your location. Objective - If there are no [[Wonderland]] locations in play, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Reinforced Reality
cards.text:
With Alice attempting to repel her own dreams from the real world, you focus on your memories of the people and places of Arkham. Each routine sound, unique scent, and memorable hallmark of the city that you can recall helps to separate the two worlds and redefine the boundaries. As you peel away Wonderland from Arkham, the impossible jumble that you left behind in the Northside and Downtown districts begins to rearrange. The overwhelming darkness begins to concentrate at the spot where Alice's house once appeared, each shadow being drawn inevitably toward it. Gurathnaka stutters, as if attempting to exist in multiple realities at once, bellowing with abominable fury as it too is drawn toward the growing void.
Put the set-aside Northside, Downtown, Easttown, and Vacuous Void locations into play. Move each investigator and weakness enemy to Easttown. Flip Gurathnaka and move it to Vacuous Void. Discard all other enemies and remove each other location from the game.

cards.flavor: Though the void draws the shadows and last vestiges of Alice's dream, Gurathnaka resists its pull, its continued howls reverberating in your bones. Its indescribable voice speaks to a primal fear within you, but the only way to survive this nightmare is to banish the Eater of Dreams.
cards.name: Darkest Before Dawn
cards.text: Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: The investigators as a group must choose and play one card from Alice's hand. Then, you may move Alice to any connecting location. [reaction] When you would discover any amount of clues, even if your location has no clues on it: You may place that many of your clues on Gurathnaka instead. Objective - If there are more clues on Gurathnaka than it has remaining health, advance.

cards.name: Call it a Night
cards.text:
Amid the rushing vacuum of the darkness through the wavering fissure, Gurathnaka claws at Arkham greedily. Each time you repel the monster, drawing from your recent experiences to weaken its grip through the dimensions. Alice focuses every fiber of her will on maintaining stability while you unravel the portal and sever Gurathnaka's attachment to Arkham. Weary minutes pass, until finally, a breakthrough! The shadowy abomination falls through the endless void, still reaching toward you with empty hunger. "It's through!" Alice cries, though you cannot make a reply before the rift sutures itself shut, and a ripple bursts forth from the point of exit, knocking you off your feet.
(→R5)

cards.flavor:
The streets of the Merchant District blend with the features of
the steep valley where the Tweedles met in their earlier battle.
cards.name: Merchant District
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. Double Merchant District's shroud for this test. If you succeed, discover an additional clue. If you fail, discard a card from your hand at random and lose a resource (limit one success per turn). Forced - If there are no clues on Merchant District: Flip it.

cards.flavor: The Merchant District returns to its lonely state, no less abandoned at night for all the chaos around it.
cards.name: Merchant District

cards.flavor: The Miskatonic river carries a salt air, and the waves wash over the riverbank as if it were Wonderland's Sea of Tears.
cards.name: Rivertown
cards.text: [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, Rivertown gets –3 shroud until the end of the phase. If you fail, take 1 damage (limit 1 success per round). Forced - If there are no clues on Rivertown: Flip it.

cards.flavor: The waters of the Miskatonic have receded, though the surface still churns with each ripple of reality.
cards.name: Rivertown

cards.flavor: Miskatonic's campus is segmented and alternates between colored sections in a pattern like the chess field of Wonderland.
cards.name: Miskatonic University
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. When you initiate this test, discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a weakness, draw it. Otherwise, you get +X [intellect] for this test, where X is the cost of the discarded card. Forced - If there are no clues on Miskatonic University: Flip it.

cards.flavor:
The university's ivy halls have returned 
and reordered, but the invasive darkness 
still pervades the campus grounds.
cards.name: Miskatonic University

cards.flavor:
The stately architecture of French Hill overlaps with ornate 
stonework that you recognize from the Queen of Hearts' castle.
cards.name: French Hill
cards.text: French Hill gets –3 shroud while there is any amount of doom on enemies at French Hill or treacheries attached to French Hill. [free] Place a doom on an enemy at French Hill or a treachery attached to French Hill. Forced - If there are no clues on French Hill: Flip it.

cards.flavor:
French Hill once again sits in its usual splendor, 
though its gambrel roofs rattle with the 
rumbling throughout the city.
cards.name: French Hill

cards.flavor: The woods outside of Arkham twist into strange shapes that you only recall from the much stranger Tulgey Wood.
cards.illustrator: Nele Diel & Alex van der Linde
cards.name: Uptown
cards.subname: Not Out of the Woods Yet
cards.text: [action]: Search your deck or discard pile for a weakness and draw it. If you drew a weakness, discover 2 clues on Uptown (limit once per turn). Forced - If there are no clues on Uptown: Flip it.

cards.flavor:
Arkham's woods unravel and twist back 
into their familiar but foreboding forms, 
giving you little peace of mind.
cards.name: Uptown

cards.flavor:
Southside's quiet roads are cluttered with 
silverware, crockery, and half-eaten refreshments 
from the Tea Party table.
cards.name: Southside
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, Southside gets –3 shroud until the end of the phase. If you fail, take 1 horror (limit 1 success per round). Forced - If there are no clues on Southside: Flip it.

cards.flavor: Southside once again sits in quiet seclusion, in stark contrast to the roiling chaos just north of it.
cards.name: Southside

cards.flavor: If you can find the first cracks of Wonderland's incursion, then perhaps you might be able to seal it for good.
cards.name: Downtown
cards.text: Forced - After you resolve a test at Downtown where 3 or more skill icons were committed: Take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
The region of Arkham where the trouble all began.
It has mostly returned to an unaltered state, suprisingly.
cards.name: Downtown

cards.flavor:
Despite its proximity to the breach between the two worlds,
Easttown is relatively untouched by the chaos.
cards.name: Easttown
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test by 2 or more at Easttown: Take 1 damage or 1 horror. [action]: Resign. There is no possible hope of repelling Gurathnaka, but there may still be a way to save yourself.

cards.flavor: Easttown has always been considered one of the safer districts due to the police presence, but in these circumstances, it's just as vulnerable as the others.
cards.name: Easttown

cards.flavor:
Remnants of the earlier chaos still linger in Northside. They may be the key to fully closing off 
the connection to Wonderland.
cards.name: Northside
cards.text: Forced - After you resolve a test at Northside where 3 or more skill icons were committed: Take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: When you left Northside behind in your journey to Wonderland, you weren't sure if you'd ever see it in a recognizable state ever again.
cards.name: Northside

cards.flavor: It will take all of your faculties to seal this rift between worlds and save Arkham from certain annihilation.
cards.name: Vacuous Void
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Vacuous Void: Discover an additional clue.

cards.flavor:
A wide tear in reality hovers far above the city.
Wind rushes in toward it, but only the 
invading shadows seem to be affected by its pull.
cards.name: Vacuous Void
Gurathnaka
cards.text:
Massive.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text: Massive. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text:
Massive. Retaliate.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text:
Massive. Retaliate.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text:
Massive. Retaliate. Alert.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text:
Massive. Retaliate. Alert.
Gurathnaka cannot be damaged.
Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions.
Investigators cannot use Alice's ability or elder sign effect during attack or evade attempts against Gurathnaka.

cards.name: Gurathnaka
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Gurathnaka gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Gurathnaka cannot be defeated by damage. Gurathnaka cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gurathnaka is ready: Add 1 doom to the current agenda.

cards.name: Insatiable Shade
cards.text:
Hunter. Alert.
Insatiable Shade's damage and horror values are 1 less than Gurathnaka's damage and horror values.

cards.name: Living Eclipse
cards.text:
Massive.
Living Eclipse's location gets +2 shroud. Each location connected to Living Eclipse's location gets +1 shroud.

cards.name: Shadowy Gorger
cards.text: Aloof. Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Shadowy Gorger is ready and unengaged: Place 1 doom on it.

cards.name: Limits of Control
cards.text: Revelation - For each weakness in Alice's hand, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to her. For each copy of Shadow Strain in Alice's hand, deal 1 additional horror to her. If there are no weaknesses in Alice's hand, Limits of Control gains surge.

cards.name: Mental Exhaustion
cards.text: Revelation - Put Mental Exhaustion into play next to the agenda deck. Investigators (including Alice) cannot draw cards during upkeep. As an additional cost to take the draw action, take 1 horror. Forced - At the end of the round, discard 1 copy of Mental Exhaustion. (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Shattering Psyche
cards.text: Revelation - Put Shattering Psyche into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After an investigator discovers 2 or more total clues or places 2 or more total clues on an enemy during their turn: Deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice. Forced - At the end of the round, discard a copy of Shattering Psyche. (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Spatial Stutter
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, resolve the following (choose one): - Move to a connecting location and take 2 damage. - Move to a location exactly 2 connections away from your location and take 1 damage. Then, if there are more clues on your new location than on your previous location: Take 1 horror.

cards.name: Weakening Boundary
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Weakening Boundary to the location with the most clues. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase: Place 1 clue (2 clues instead if there are 3 or 4 players) on the attached location (from the token bank) or place 1 doom on Weakening Boundary (choose one). If it is act 2, you cannot choose to place clues. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Weakening Boundary. Forced - If Weakening Boundary's location is flipped, discard Weakening Boundary.

cards.name: Tenebrous Nightmares
cards.text: Revelation - Put Tenebrous Nightmares into play in your threat area. You cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase. [action] [action]: Discard Tenebrous Nightmares.

cards.back_flavor: The investigators have traversed Wonderland and returned to Arkham to find Alice still at the center of the chaos. Can the investigators help separate Wonderland from Arkham before Gurathnaka can secure itself in reality? Will Alice even be able to withstand the strain of her dreams bridging dimensions?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 24 Deckbuilding Options: Follow the Alice's Assistance section in the campaign guide to construct Alice's deck. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): All cards included are determined by the investigator's choices.
cards.flavor: "Curiouser and curiouser."
cards.name: Alice Liddell
cards.text:
[reaction] When an investigator at Alice's location would test with any skill: Use Alice's base [intellect] for that skill instead (limit once for each investigator per round).
[elder_sign] +0. Choose and shuffle a card from your discard pile back into your deck. Any investigator at Alice's location may use this effect instead of their own elder sign effect.

cards.name: Alice's Courage
cards.text: Put Alice's Courage into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator engages or becomes engaged with an enemy: That investigator may draw a card. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Courage.

cards.name: Alice's Compassion
cards.text: Put Alice's Compassion into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator heals any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator heals 1 additional damage or horror (choose one). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Compassion.

cards.name: Alice's Patience
cards.text: Put Alice's Patience into play next to Alice. [reaction] After an investigator resolves a test where they committed a skill card to that test: That investigator may draw a card. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Patience.

cards.name: Alice's Curiosity
cards.text: Put Alice's Curiosity into play next to Alice. [reaction] After an investigator moves: That investigator gets +1 on all skill tests until the end of their turn (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Curiosity.

cards.name: Alice's Intuition
cards.text: Put Alice's Intuition into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator would play an event: That event gains fast (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Intuition.

cards.name: Alice's Reason
cards.text: Put Alice's Reason into play next to Alice. [free] An investigator performing a test gets +X to that test, where X is the amount of clues they control (to a maximum of 4, limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Alice's Reason.

cards.name: Lack of Courage
cards.text: Put Lack of Courage into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator engages or becomes engaged with an enemy: That investigator discards a card from their hand at random. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Courage.

cards.name: Lack of Compassion
cards.text: Put Lack of Compassion into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator heals any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator heals 1 less damage and/or horror. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Compassion.

cards.name: Lack of Patience
cards.text: Put Lack of Patience into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator is performing a test: That investigator must commit a skill card to that test if possible. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Patience.

cards.name: Lack of Curiosity
cards.text: Put Lack of Curiosity into play next to Alice. Forced - After an investigator moves: That investigator gets –1 on all skill tests until the end of their turn. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Curiosity.

cards.name: Lack of Intuition
cards.text: Put Lack of Intuition into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator would play an event: That investigator must spend 2 additional resources. At the end of the round, discard Lack of Intuition.

cards.name: Lack of Reason
cards.text: Put Lack of Reason into play next to Alice. Forced - The first test each investigator performs gets -X, where X is the amount of clues they control (to a maximum of –4). At the end of the round, discard Lack of Reason.

cards.flavor:
The White Rabbit leaps past you, tapping 
his pocket watch frantically. "There are still 
seconds to spare! Use them quickly!"
cards.name: Still Ticking
cards.text: Put Still Ticking into play next to Alice. Move all doom from all enemies and treacheries in play to Still Ticking. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Still Ticking.

cards.flavor:
A broken pocket watch lies on the ground in front
of you, stuck just one minute to twelve o'clock.
cards.name: Running Out of Time
cards.text: Put Running Out of Time into play next to Alice. Forced - After an investigator fails a test against an enemy: Place 1 doom on that enemy (limit once per investigator turn). At the end of the round, discard Running Out of Time.

cards.flavor: The Walrus and the Carpenter are suddenly walking beside you, providing many insights that are strangely useful.
cards.name: Talk of Many Things
cards.text: Put Talk of Many Things into play next to Alice. Each investigator other than Alice may immediately draw up to 3 cards. Investigators may choose not to discard cards during the upkeep phase. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Talk of Many Things.

cards.flavor: But answer came there none —
cards.name: Shed a Bitter Tear
cards.text: Put Shed a Bitter Tear into play next to Alice. Forced - As an additional cost to play an asset or event, an investigator must discard another card from their hand. At the end of the round, discard Shed a Bitter Tear.

cards.flavor:
"More tea?" The Hatter and the March Hare reach
from above and below you, offering refreshments.
cards.name: The Best Butter
cards.text: Put The Best Butter into play next to Alice. [free] During an investigator's turn, that investigator may play an asset from their hand, paying half its cost, rounded up (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard The Best Butter.

cards.flavor:
Cups and saucers fly, hurled at the shadows by the
sole remaining occupant of the tea party table.
cards.name: Wasn't Very Civil
cards.text: Put Wasn't Very Civil into play next to Alice. [free] During an investigator's turn, that investigator may play an asset from their hand, paying its cost (limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Wasn't Very Civil.

cards.flavor:
A cracked tea set sits on the ground before you,
smeared with butter, jam, and blood.
cards.name: Empty Table
cards.text: Put Empty Table into play next to Alice. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator discards an asset they control or discards two assets from their hand (choose one). Then, discard Empty Table.

cards.flavor:
The Queen of Hearts is suddenly beside you, 
flanked by dozens of card guards and still 
bearing a grudge against the shadows.
cards.name: The Queen's Justice
cards.text: Put The Queen's Justice into play next to Alice. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase: Deal 1 damage to each enemy in play. For each enemy defeated by this effect, each investigator other than Alice may gain 1 resource. At the end of the round, discard The Queen's Justice.

cards.flavor: You happen across an enormous pool of blood with the Queen of Hearts' crown half-sunken into it.
cards.name: Broke Her Crown
cards.text: Put Broke Her Crown into play next to Alice. Forced - When an enemy would enter the encounter discard pile or victory display: Place that enemy back on top of the encounter deck instead. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Broke Her Crown.

cards.flavor:
Astonishingly, the Snark stands before you once again,
ready to assist you with its many talents.
cards.name: Qualities of a Snark
cards.text: Put Qualities of a Snark into play next to Alice. Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators...- ...commanded the Snark,all investigators get +1 [willpower].- ...puzzled the Snark,all investigators get +1 [intellect].- ...intimidated the Snark,all investigators get +1 [combat].- ...tricked the Snark,all investigators get +1 [agility].- ...intrigued the Snark,all investigators get +1 to all skills. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Qualities of a Snark.

cards.flavor:
"But if ever I meet with a Boojum, that day,
In a moment (of this I am sure),
I shall softly and suddenly vanish away—
And the notion I cannot endure!"
cards.name: Softly and Suddenly Vanished
cards.text: Put Softly and Suddenly Vanished into play next to Alice. Forced - After an [[Ally]] asset controlled by an investigator takes any amount of damage or horror: Defeat that [[Ally]] asset. At the end of the round, discard Softly and Suddenly Vanished.

cards.flavor:
"O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!"
He chortled in his joy."
cards.name: Galumphing Back
cards.text: Put Galumphing Back into play next to Alice. [reaction] When an investigator would take any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator takes 1 fewer damage or horror (choose one). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Galumphing Back.

cards.flavor:
"Beware the Jabberwock, my son!
The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!"
cards.name: Jaws That Bite
cards.text: Put Jaws That Bite into play next to Alice. Forced - When an investigator would take any amount of damage and/or horror: That investigator takes 1 additional damage or horror (choose one). At the end of the round, discard Jaws That Bite.

cards.flavor: Tweedledum and Tweedledee stand shoulder to shoulder, ready to assist in their own meager way.
cards.name: Brothers in Arms
cards.text: Put Brothers in Arms into play next to Alice. [reaction] When a card would enter an investigator's discard pile: That investigator may place it on top of their deck instead (Limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Brothers in Arms.

cards.flavor: The living Tweedle focuses his grief and anger at the shadows that indirectly caused him to lose his brother.
cards.name: Sole Survivor
cards.text: Put Sole Survivor into play next to Alice. [reaction] When a card would enter an investigator's discard pile: That investigator may shuffle it into their deck instead (Limit once per investigator). Forced - At the end of the round, discard Sole Survivor.

cards.flavor: Cracked pots, dented washtubs, and shredded pillows lie in a heap, each piece speckled with blood.
cards.name: No Survivors
cards.text: Put No Survivors into play next to Alice. Forced - When a non-weakness card would enter an investigator's discard pile: Remove that card from the game instead. At the end of the round, discard No Survivors.

cards.flavor:
The White King appears, commanding an army of
chess pieces that obey his every whim.
cards.name: Royal Decree
cards.text: Put Royal Decree into play next to Alice. Each investigator other than Alice may gain up to 4 resources. Playing assets or events does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Royal Decree.

cards.flavor: "For the want of a battle the kingdom was lost..."
cards.name: For Want of a Nail
cards.text: Put For Want of a Nail into play next to Alice. Investigators cannot activate [free] or [reaction] abilities, or play events with the fast keyword. Forced - At the end of the round, discard For Want of a Nail.

cards.flavor: With a victorious cheer, the White Knight gallops onto the field of battle, barely keeping his place in the saddle.
cards.name: Glory and Honor
cards.text: Put Glory and Honor into play next to Alice. All abilities on treachery and weakness cards require one fewer action to activate. If an ability on a treachery or weakness only requires one action, it can be activated as a [free] instead. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Glory and Honor.

cards.flavor:
You find a shattered sword lying on the ground,
alongside several dented pieces of armor.
cards.name: The Better Part of Valor
cards.text: Put The Better Part of Valor into play next to Alice. All abilities on treachery and weakness cards require an additional action to activate. Forced - At the end of the round, discard The Better Part of Valor.

cards.name: Shadow Strain
cards.text: Put Shadow Strain into play next to Alice. Set Alice's base [intellect] to 1. Forced - At the end of the round, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to Alice (choose one) and discard Shadow Strain.

cards.flavor:
"You must be," said the Cat,
"or you wouldn't have come here."
cards.name: The Cheshire Cat
cards.text: Permanent. [reaction] When you would fail a skill test by exactly 1: You automatically succeed instead. Flip The Cheshire Cat. Forced - When the player controlling The Cheshire Cat would be defeated or would resign: Choose another player. That player immediately takes control of The Cheshire Cat.

cards.flavor:
"If you don't know where you want to go,
then it doesn't matter which path you take."
cards.name: The Cheshire Cat
cards.text: Permanent. Forced - When you would succeed a skill test by exactly 1: You automatically fail instead. Flip The Cheshire Cat. Forced - When the player controlling The Cheshire Cat would be defeated or would resign: Choose another player. That player immediately takes control of The Cheshire Cat.

cards.name: Nonsensical Advice
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Shuffle any amount of cards from your hand back into your deck and draw an equal amount of cards. For each card you did not shuffle back into your deck, lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor: "I'd rather not," the Cat remarked.
cards.name: Petulant Creature
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Flip The Cheshire Cat.

cards.name: Vanished Away
cards.text: Surge. Peril. Revelation - Choose a player who does not currently control The Cheshire Cat. That player immediately takes control of The Cheshire Cat. If there is only one active player, ignore this revelation effect.

cards.name: Card Guard (Clubs)
cards.text: Forced - After Card Guard (Clubs) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [combat] icon. If you cannot, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Card Guard (Diamonds)
cards.text: Forced - After Card Guard (Diamonds) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [agility] icon. If you cannot, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Card Guard (Hearts)
cards.text: Forced - After Card Guard (Hearts) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [willpower] icon. If you cannot, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Card Guard (Spades)
cards.text: Forced - After Card Guard (Spades) attacks you: Choose and discard a card from your hand with at least 1 [intellect] icon. If you cannot, take 1 horror.

cards.name: Misdeal
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (1). This test's difficulty increases by 1 for every 2 [[Card]] enemies in the encounter discard pile. If you fail, discard 2 cards from your hand at random. Then, if you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Weak Hand
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and peril if there is a [[Card]] enemy at your location. For each point you fail by, take 1 horror or choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Red Bishop
cards.text:
Alert.
Each other [[Chess]] enemy at this location gains Alert.

cards.name: Red Knight
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - After Red Knight attacks you: Lose 1 resource (2 resources instead if Red Knight moved to your location before attacking).

cards.name: Red Pawn
cards.text: The first Red Pawn drawn each mythos phase gains surge.

cards.name: Red Rook
cards.text:
Retaliate.
Each other [[Chess]] enemy at this location gains Retaliate.

cards.name: Exchange Sacrifice
cards.text: Revelation - Put Exchange Sacrifice into play next to the agenda. Forced - After a [[Chess]] enemy is defeated or discarded: The investigator that defeated or discarded that enemy takes 1 damage or loses 2 resources. Then, discard Exchange Sacrifice.

cards.name: Threatened Position
cards.text: Revelation - Put Threatened Position into play in your threat area. While there is a [[Chess]] enemy at your location, you get –2 to all skills during skill tests except during fight or evade attempts. [action] [action]: Discard Threatened Position.

cards.name: Animated Shadow
cards.text: X is equal to the engaged investigator's base [combat]. Animated Shadow cannot make attacks of opportunity or be engaged by other investigators. Forced - If Animated Shadow is evaded, defeat it. If the investigator engaged with Animated Shadow is defeated or resigns, discard Animated Shadow.

cards.name: Haunting Shade
cards.text:
Hunter. Aloof.
Haunting Shade's location gets +2 shroud. If there are no clues on its location, Haunting Shade loses aloof and gets +1 fight and +1 damage.

cards.name: Deepening Dusk
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. The attached location gets +1 shroud. [[Shadow]] enemies at the attached location get +1 fight and +1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Deepening Dusk.

cards.name: Edge of Your Vision
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is equal to your location's shroud value. If you fail, search the encounter discard pile and deck for a [[Shadow]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you. If you searched the encounter deck, shuffle it. Then, take 1 horror for each [[Shadow]] enemy at your location.

cards.flavor: In any other realm, you would want to succeed.
cards.name: Backward Logic
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (5). Treat "–" modifiers on revealed tokens as "+", and "+" modifiers on revealed tokens as "–". Icons committed to this test subtract from your total instead of add to it. If you succeed, lose 1 action. If you succeeded by 2 or more, take 1 horror. If you fail, nothing happens.

cards.name: Brain Teaser
cards.text: Revelation - Put Brain Teaser into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When doom would be placed on any other card (including the agenda): Place 1 doom on Brain Teaser (limit once per phase). [action]: Test [intellect] (4). This test gets –1 difficulty for each doom on Brain Teaser. If you succeed, discard Brain Teaser.

cards.name: Questioning the Answer
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If there are no clues on your location, cards cannot be committed to this test. If you fail, take 1 horror and discard 1 card from your hand at random.

cards.name: Strange Challenge
cards.text: Revelation - Test any skill (4). If you fail, take 2 damage and put Strange Challenge into play in your threat area. Set the base value of the earlier chosen skill to 1. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Strange Challenge.

cards.name: Cognitive Dissonance
cards.text: Revelation - If you do not control any clues, Cognitive Dissonance gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue you control (to a maximum of +3). If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location. If you fail by 2 or more, lose 1 action.

cards.name: Curiouser and Curiouser
cards.text: Revelation - Put Curiouser and Curiouser into play in your threat area. Forced - As an additional cost to investigate, if there are more clues on any other location than on your location: Take 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Curiouser and Curiouser.

cards.name: Disjunction
cards.text: Revelation - Discard any number of cards from your hand or from play whose total cost is equal to or greater than your location's shroud value. If you cannot, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: Impossible Paths
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Impossible Paths to your location. Forced - When you would take an action to move from the attached location: Test [agility] (0). This test's difficulty increases by 1 for each location connected to your location. If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. [action] [action]: Discard Impossible Paths.

cards.name: Humpty Dumpty
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Humpty Dumpty into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When a [tablet] token is revealed during a skill test: Treat that token as a [auto_fail] token instead. Discard Humpty Dumpty.

cards.name: The Caterpillar
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Put The Caterpillar into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from any location: Each investigator must discard 1 card from their hand at random. Discard The Caterpillar.

cards.name: The Dodo

cards.back_flavor: It was often said that Alice lived in her own little world.  Alice had to agree of course, as she had been there several times before.  She knew that Wonderland was a dream, but it all seemed as real to her as her native England.  This belief attracted the attention of a shadowy being named Gurathnaka who saw opportunity in Alice's dreams.  As Alice grew, it tried to solidify her belief in Wonderland until it began to merge with the real world.  Alice attempted to outrun the spreading chaos, until her journeys brought her to Arkham, Massachusetts where a group of investigators freed her mind from Gurathnaka's influence.  Alice has vowed to repay their deeds by helping to solve as many of Arkham's bizarre happenings as she can.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5, cards with "uses (secrets)" level 0–2, up to five other level 0 Mystic and/or Survivor cards ([mystic] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mysteries of Wonderland, Lost in Thought, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "Curiouser and curiouser."
cards.name: Alice Liddell
cards.text:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location initiates a skill test: Set the base value for that skill equal to Alice's base [intellect] for that test. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] +0. Choose and shuffle a card from your discard pile back into your deck. Any investigator at your location may use this effect instead of their own elder sign effect.

cards.flavor: `And how do you know that you’re mad?’
cards.name: Mysteries of Wonderland
cards.text:
Alice Liddell deck only.
[free] During a skill test you are performing, exhaust Mysteries of Wonderland: You get +X skill value for this test, where X is the highest number of secrets on an asset you control (to a maximum of +4). After that test resolves, remove 1 secret from that asset.

cards.name: Lost in Thought
cards.text: Uses (0 secrets). If there are 4 or more secrets on Lost in Thought, discard it. Revelation - Put Lost in Thought into play in your threat area. Set your base [intellect] to X, where X is the number of secrets on Lost in Thought. Ignore any other game effect that would change your base [intellect]. [free] Move 1 secret from an asset you control to Lost in Thought. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Lost in Thought from the token bank, as a secret.
